Reviews.Title: “Good downtown location”
Reviews.Author: heranaway
Reviews.Content: We had trouble finding the hotel as it is very poorly signposted, I do not think there is even one. Mention Court street and number 1 Washington street to the taxi driver to avoid a fare pile up. Checking was smooth, rooms...very contemporary but not very comfortable in my opinion. The shower is probably the best thing in the room. For Internet access this hotel charges $10 per night which is somewhat fare compared with other hotels. If you went on the third floor into the business room you can print your boarding pass for free. Take the old town tour to get a view of the city make sure you only get a one day pass. The best restaurant we went to was California pizza kitchen in the Prudential centre followed by desert in the cheesecake factory.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: jm17_12
Reviews.Content: When I checked into the hotel, my hotel room was upgraded and was available as soon as I checked in (I arrived about 4 hours before the "check-in" time. The hotel and the room is very clean and trendy, and the location is great, being about a 5-10min walk to the Quincy Market area. In the drawer of the bedside table are earplugs, in case the street noise is too much when you're sleeping. I didn't have a problem with the noise at all, but it wasn't anything bad (can hear loud trucks from time to time). The only thing that I wish was different were the curtains on the window. They're nice, but they're white, so they don't really block out the light from the outside. I'd prefer dark curtains, but I had a great sleep nonetheless! I would definately reccomend this hotel, as it's close to everything, great staff, and beautiful rooms. Next time that I'm in Boston, I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: oldprop13
Reviews.Content: I visit Boston several times a year and this year and look for a centrally located hotel b/c I love walking around Boston. The hotel's location is excellent. One block off of Tremont, 10 minutes tops to the North End and maybe 15 minutes to the Garden. If you are not inclined to walk it is a 6$ cab ride from the Garden or the North End. If you stumble going out the door you'll roll downhill right into Faneuil Hall. If you come into south station it is an easy 15 minute walk to the hotel. The staff is very friendly. We came in for the Hockey East tournament and St. Patrick's Day. Everyone seems to really enjoy working there and was enthusiastic while helping you out. Even if they are Terriers helping Black Bears! They have a nice bar which seems to attract the local young professionals and hotel residents but not many other tourists. This is most likely because of the fact it isn't the easiest place to find and it is not well marked. I got a great rate on a promo and i will stay here again even though i usually only stay at hotels offering promo rates.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable trip!”
Reviews.Author: Allison_E60795
Reviews.Content: Booked Ames for St Patty's day weekend! When we arrived, the hotel was a little hard to find, you just have to look for the arched windows half way up the building. The staff was very professional and helpful. We were upgraded to a king room, which was very clean and comfortable with a nice view. Hotel location was fantastic, right in the middle of everything you want to see! Street noise level was pretty loud but that didn't bother us, especially for being in our 20s on St Patty's Day weekend! My only complaint was the the shower stall, which had glass walls and was large enough for a romantic time for two, only had a half wall on one side. Water kept spilling onto the bathroom floor, so make sure you put enough towels on the floor near the entrance of the shower stall. Other than that, the hotel was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anthony757
Reviews.Content: The Ames Hotel is very stylish, with modern interiors and furnishings. The rooms were very well presented and the beds extremely comfortable. Bathrooms are fitted with a 'rain shower' head which was a real treat! The bar and breakfast area was in keeping with the stylish, minimal look. All the staff we encountered we're very attentive and nothing was too much trouble. This hotels location is perfect for visitors, being close to the Common and just 15 minutes walk to Copley Square.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Joy”
Reviews.Author: iain s
Reviews.Content: Located just off the waterfront this is a luxury hotel with an interesting history, it was the first skyscraper in Boston built before steel fabrication so has 9 foot thick lower walls. The decor is modern and smart, tempered with the odd artefact on display that links the hotel to its past. The 'meeting and greeting from the front of house was excellant, and their knowledge of where to visit to soak up the atmosphere was fantastic. My room was imaculate and extraordinarily comfortable, with a well stocked mini bar and superb bed. The food and bar service was again excellant and the portions were just right for me. Would I recommend Ames? Of course I would as it is a haven that any Englishman would enjoy and feel at home in, despite the history of the Tea Party

Reviews.Title: “Modern & Unique”
Reviews.Author: OP87
Reviews.Content: The Ames hotel is in a great location!It's very much a boutique hotel. The decor is very modern and the ceilings are very tall. It is a unique experience and one that I recommend. The staff was fantastic and the customer service was extraordinary. We found some old chicken wings that were left on top of the refrigerator and they were quickly disposed of by staff, the manager apologized and we were compensated with a free breakfast. We did not use the breakfast coupons as we already had other plans, but their swift response was appreciated!The only negative was signage, there is no main sign and we drove in circles for a bit looking for the building!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel with Disappointing Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: KMacBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a local hotel for an anniversary celebration. I was considering a different hotel when I received an email advertising a living social voucher for an overnight stay. When I called the hotel to make the reservation using the voucher they told me that the voucher was not available on the night that I chose although the voucher stated specific blackout dates that were different than the night I chose. The voucher was only valid for 3 months. I had to complain and escalate the situation to corporate in order to book my room. I was given a room that was a lower grade than stated on the voucher with no further compensation. On arrival at the hotel, the doorman was not available. I had to walk into the hotel in order to request valet parking. I could go on, but you get the idea. This hotel is not terribly concerned with customer service. As I mentioned to the corporate representative.. if you dont want to honor a voucher then don't offer it. I would have booked a different hotel. On a positive note the rooms are very nice, although very modern so maybe not to everyone's taste. We had dinner and breakfast in the Hotel restaurant the Woodward. I would highly recommend this restaurant. We had two delicious meals. If the customer service was better I would highly recommend this hotel, until then I would choose someplace different.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jbud10
Reviews.Content: Visited the Ames for the weekend with girlfriend to do some shopping, eating and drinking in Boston. We were looking for a hotel within walking distance to Faneuil Hall, Quincy market, Aquarium, Bars, and the rest of downtown Boston. Found it. Upon pulling up you can park right in front and get valet service for roughly $45 bucks, or you can pull into a garage across the street, in retrospect, we would have just used a garage but it was very convenint to just pull up and let the staff take care of everything. The staff were very hospitable, and we were introduced to all individually and provided a warm initial impression. They were very accomodating and welcoming. We were taken to our room and shown around it, we had the loft category room. We were impressed by the modern decor and the great bedroom and living room separated by a small dividor in the middle of the room which has HD Tv's on both sides (one for bedroom/one for living room area). Bathroom was large and had everything you needed, shower was great, high power great body washes, etc. The bathroom was a huge window however, where you can be in the bed and look directly into it. Not a big deal for us, thought it was clever, but there is a curtain you can draw for a little more privacy.Noise a tnight was present, but you have ear plugs provided if you need them. Great space and perfect for a place to crash and relax in between going around Boston. We visited the hotel bar the Woodward for a few drinks before hitting the town, great sleection, very friendly staff, it was very crowded at 6:30-7 so if you plan on goign for happy hour, you have been warned. We were lucky to have to hostess find us a table to jus thave drinks at for a while and satified our needs. We also had breakfast here and it was pleasant, we received a voucher through our booking agency so it was fre, but given the quality, believe we would gladly pay next tiem around. You will not need a car here as it is within walking distance to everywhere despite how intimidating the walk appears on Google maps. Quincy Market/Faneuil Hall all 2 minutes from front door of Ames. If you want to venture to a restaraunt a little further, simply let the front door man know and he will waves a taxi down for you. Overall, this was the bes thotel experaince we have had in Boston thus far and would reccomend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Hotel BUut Maybe Not For Everyone”
Reviews.Author: TommyKConnecticut
Reviews.Content: The Ames Boston is a beautiful hotel with excellent service. It is in a tremendous location within easy walking distance of most of the popular spots and near the T if you prefer not to walk. The staff and service was excellent. It is truly a boutique hotel with a decor that may not be for everyone. As noted in other reviews you need to really watch for the hotel as there is no sign for it. The rooms were spotless and very attractive. Large flat screen tv on the wall, large walk-in glass shower and a stocked pantry and mini mar with everything you could think of. Very comfortable bed as well. The only downside for us is that it can be a little loud. We could clearly hear voices and people returning to their rooms at bar closing around 1:45am which woke us up but that was not enough to complain about or spoil the night. The value was excellent as we booked through Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Ames Hotel a Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: JonnyBeGood
Reviews.Content: The Ames Hotel is certainly a hidden gem. My first stay we walked right by the hotel not realizing it was there (there's no sign). The hotel is in an old historic building but don't let that fool you. The hotel on the inside is very modern. The rooms are large, comfortable very clean with high ceilings with a very large and modern bathroom. Customer service at the hotel is second to none. Upon checking in the front desk associate upgraded us to a deluxe room at no charge. The front desk, bell staff, housekeeping staff and restaurant staff, were accommodating, and extremely generous with their time, and clearly took joy in keeping the customer satisfied and more. Â  (My most recent experience with a Boston Hotel was at the Parker House and I had the exact opposite experience there). The Woodward bar was hopping with young professionals and two old people (My wife and I). Service was excellent. The drinks are not cheap but they have a lot of unique drinks on the menu so its' definitely worthwhile trying out the Woodward. The Ames is in a great location close to Faneuil Hall, Beacon Hill, the Theater District and more importantly close to the North End and Regina's Pizza and Mike's pastry (For the best pizza and cannolis in the world). The Ames is my new favorite hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite Boston hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: cmiss24
Reviews.Content: Once again Priceline saves the day. For my husbands birthday I wanted to take him to Boston for the night so I threw out a low number and I got the Ames hotel. The staff that greeted us and checked us in were fantastic!!! The hotel itself is gorgeous and very modern. Our room was on the 14th floor and we had an amazing view out of huge windows. The room was very cool with a glass shower that looks into the room. The location was unreal. About a 2 min walk to Quincy market and less than ten minutes to the north end. Charles recommended a great place for lunch called Mare which we loved. At night we wanted to make a few drinks and realized there was no ice bucket.....called down to the front desk and in 2 minutes we had an ice bucket delivered to our door! The only drawback was that since it is in a fantastic location you can hear some noise from the street level. It wasn't that loud and it only reinforced to us how close we were to fun bars!! Next time we are in Boston we are definitely staying at the Ames hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern design inside the historic Ames building”
Reviews.Author: dougwig
Reviews.Content: My wife an I were looking for something different for a weekend getaway and chose the Ames Hotel. The hotel is near Government Center and Faneuil Hall and the Theatre district so there's plenty nearby, but you'll need to walk a little. The front desk nicely granted our wish to have a room on the 9th floor where the rooms have arched windows. The room was sleek and modern with 12' ceilings, a dark gray slate bathroom and an unusual shower ( see photos ). We really enjoyed staying in this unique modern hotel. Note: The downtown location makes for a little more street noise than you might expect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: carla b
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was amazing. The front desk was very friendly and helpful. We were given an upgrade which was great! Our room was very nice, and had a wonderful view of Boston. The bathroom had the best skin/hair care products. The hotel restaurant was very nice, and flexible. We had a last minute change of plans and had to reschedule our dinner reservation. They were very nice about it, and we were surprised that they were even able to do it due to the volume of people waiting to eat. Also, breakfast at the restaurant was very yummy, and quick!! We also enjoyed how close we were to a lot of Boston attractions and shopping. It was so easy to just walk out the hotel door and explore the North end. We will definitely be staying at the Ames Boston again!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: stanmes99
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is not located in the prettiest part of town that is not the most charming, it is just seconds away from all key transportation points and a short walk to fanueil hall. The room was beautiful, decent size and the restaurant and bar downstairs are great though both were a littl epricey.

Reviews.Title: “I really liked this hotel, but not for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: NYLady4
Reviews.Content: This is a great Morgan's group hotel -- great decor, rooms have very high ceilings with huge windows, comfy bed, great toiletries, nice restaurant, great mini-bar items, very convenient location. Its obviously got the art-deco South Beach thing going on (which I love). When I got to my room I was really happy I picked it for my trip..... and then I went to sleep (or tried to). The hotel is right over the T, and if you are a light sleeper like I am (but probably not a normal or heavy sleeper), you will be up all night, even with earplugs in (it is sound and vibration). And I was on the second highest floor. But if you have no sleep issues, it is a touch of style in downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JLinnean
Reviews.Content: My g/f and I stayed here for a weekend and were very happy with the experience. Beautiful hotel and very close to the Quincy Market area and a T stop. So we had no issue finding things to do. Also, the concierge Charles was extremely helpful getting us tickets to a Celtics and making a dinner reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Efficient But Without Charm”
Reviews.Author: C0rgiL0ver
Reviews.Content: I find it difficult to understand why this hotel is accorded so many superlative comments. That being said, believe me when I say the staff is great--- accomodating and friendly. However, the entire experience left me a bit cold. The decor is too sterile for my taste. It was also a tad bit expensive. I wouldn't have minded the extra dollars had the presentation been somewhat more to my liking. There is nothing wrong with this hotel. It simply does not conform to my taste.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to plan a last minute (about 4 days prior) trip to Boston for New Years Eve. I looked around a little until I found the Ames which was right in the middle of everything pretty much. The price was really not that bad considering how late I booked. I did not go through the hotel's website as it was about 100.00 more expensive than priceline. The room was very nice. It had cathedral ceilings which made up for the size of the room. The furniture was very nice and modern and despite some negative reviews about the bathroom I had read, it was nice and the shower did not make that much of a mess at all. We usually stay in Kimpton Hotels but I think we will definately switch to the Ames when in Boston. Warning, not a hotel for families or people that are light sleepers. My wife and I enjoy the sounds of the city but if you are sensitive to it then this will be a problem for you. Overall very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: BazilFawlty007
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location for public transport. Close to the airport but fairly expensive cab trip due to Tolls. When I left to catch my Acella train to NYC, I walked to the station The hotel was basically a mini W hotel. Really good personal service with comfortable modern, but not overly modern rooms. The restaurant in the lobby is BRILLIANT. The bar staff are true mixologists and the food is in one word, special. I had 3 dinners and a breakfast there and each one was great. A standout dish was a special appetizer of the night - Bone Marrow it was perfectly done. I asked the waiter to bring me something from the bar knowing what I was eating and asked that it not be beer or wine as the marrow is so rich it needs a cocktail. What he bought back was a crafted drink that had, amongst other things, Bourbon and a burnt orange twist. The whole experience at that hotel showed an uncommon attention to detail. I did the the Sam Adams brewery tour and was underwhelmed. I love the beer too. Namy people told me that the Harpoon brewery is a better tour.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay, but some gotchas..”
Reviews.Author: ob0t
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that the Ames is one of the nicest hotels I've stayed in. The room decor is very nice indeed, with clean white lines and brilliant use of the space. We booked a corner view room, and had a great view of the surrounding area. Also, the door staff were very friendly and helpful. I would give this hotel 5 stars, but we were let down by a couple of things.. First of all, the restaurant - the service is very good indeed, but the food was somewhat lacking - my girlfriend order lobster, which was overcooked and swimming in butter, and our desserts were a little tasteless. Second, we found the staff on the main desk a little brusque in their manner, which made checking in and out a somewhat unpleasant experience. Those issues aside, I would not hesitate to star in the Ames again, nor to recommend it to anyone visiting Boston on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Ames Hotel Boston”
Reviews.Author: m1a2tanks
Reviews.Content: As seasoned travelers to Boston, I was unsure about this hotel at first. However, the location was so good, I could have put up with a few flaws. That said, there weren't many. The corner room was excellent, great city views from the spacious windows. The room was clean, sleek and very comfortable. Can't say enough about the bellman, who was very courteous and met us with a friendly smile every day. Location: right downtown near Fanueil Hall and the Market. So close to places like the Union Street Oyster Bar and Legal Seafoods you wouldn't believe. The restaurant is not bad, but there's so much around, it's probably better as a place for a nightcap.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not memorable”
Reviews.Author: Hotelsnobb
Reviews.Content: As locals, we were excited when we finally got a chance to stay here for a wedding. The hotel is actually in a beautiful historic building in Boston. Luckily we knew exactly where it was or never would've found it! If you're not familiar with the area, definitely use a GPS or get an exact location with landmarks. It's in a great location if you want to be in the financial district, historic area, Fanieul Hall area, and not that far from the waterfront. Valet/bellman service when we arrived was neither friendly or helpful. The valet/bellman watched me struggle with a few bags and didn't offer to take more than the one he had. He basically dumped me off in the room without offering any information about the room and where things were located. Rooms were clean and beautiful, but very sparse and I thought, a little cold and uninviting. Bathrooms were roomy with nice products. I found it odd and a little off putting that there were no robes in the room...you actually have to call and get them from housekeeping! Breakfast in the restaurant was superb! The food was outstanding, but the service again, wasn't friendly. Although this hotel was beautiful, the service is not up to the standards of this category of hotel,especially as pricey as it is.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: allseas1586
Reviews.Content: Spent three night at Ames while visiting on business. Arrived around 8pm via the T (Blue Line from the airport) from the State Street station right across the street. Was greeted by the doorman and the two staff at the front desk, who quickly got me on my way upstairs. Room was a superior king, and fulfilled all of my needs. Loved the rainfall shower! While I was on a higher floor, there was still quite a bit of noise at night, both from the street and from the other rooms. Not a real problem though. Ate at the Woodward one night, food was good. Hotel's location was also excellent, easy walk over to Fanuil Hall Marketplace. One tip when visiting Boston: make sure to go over to the North End and eat at one of the many Italian restaurants. I found it to be an easy walk, and the surrounding areas all seemed safe.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hikemom
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff greeted me on arrival. My suite was spacious, modern and comfortable. Stunning city view, cozy lobby bar and excellent restaurant. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the Financial District”
Reviews.Author: Wineknut
Reviews.Content: The Ames is located in a lovely, preserved, historic "skyscraper" from long ago in the perfect location (easy access from the Airport on the Blue Line). The Ames has managed a perfect blend of respect for history and while embracing all that is hip. The rooms are small (as is expected in a major city urban hotel) but thoughtfully laid out and thus don't feel cramped. There is enough room to do a little work or hang out without feeling claustrophobic. Beautiful linens, nice bath amenities - in short a lot of attention to detail that results in a room that is comfortable and chic. Don't miss the restaurant at Ames - Woodward, especially for excellent cocktails. (make sure you ask how it got its name. We were very entertained by a waiter during a quiet perior with the historic scandal!) I am so comfortable with the level of service that I often put clients there. Everyone I have sent there has loved the place. This is my new favorite Boston hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great room.”
Reviews.Author: foinikas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AMES for 2 nights. We had a room on a high floor. We loved our room. It was wonderful. We also liked the restaurant and the bar. The stuff was very friendly. Thanks a lot guys. We had a nice stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: baddabingtmc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here day before new years. Was nice. Looks like good hotel if I was working in downtown boston rooms are quaint. Probably not a family hotel. More for couples

Reviews.Title: “Stylish stay in Downtown, perfect for both business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: unbiasedadvisor
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in downtown Boston, the Ames is a true boutique hotel that offers a chic, intimate experience. My friend mentioned that the bar/restaurant downstairs was excellent, and I saw a great crowd of people there at a weekend. Stepping out of a lift you see a carpeted, rather sophisticated hallway with a high ceiling. The atmosphere quickly reminds you that this is a boutique hotel in the sense that everything is dark and is reminiscent of nightclubs. When you open the door to your room, however, what you see is not a typical carpeted hotel room. In truth I felt like as though I was walking into someoneâ€™s apartment. The room I stayed in is furnished with elegant, minimalistic furniture and has a light hardwood floor and huge windows. The ceiling is quite high, as is the case with the hallway, and the view from my 8th floor corner room is not fantastic, but perhaps better than the most hotel rooms. The high ceiling and oversized windows certainly give the room a sense of openness. Below are some observations I would like to share with you: - As you can see from my photos of the room, there is no bathtub, despite the large-size bathroom. It seems most rooms are only quipped with showers, some of which are considerate of guests with disabilities and children. Also, the front door has two peepholes for the same purpose. - I stayed in November and without a pair of slippers it was very cold to walk barefoot on a bathroom floor. (I had the same problem at the Intercontinental in the neighbourhood.) - There is a decent hair dryer in the room - powerful and emitting negative ion - The lights in the bathroom are too dim, even with the dimming controls. You cannot apply makeup in the dark. - Has a unique stock in the mini-bar, such as sleeping pills. - Front doors are heavy thus the hotel needs to fix the door-slamming problem. - Has a motorised shade control system - The bed is quite comfortable - The room is kept clean - Has a heated towel rack Prior to my trip, I read several reviews on noise complaints, so I emailed the manager Nina (nina.sweet@morganshotelgroup.com) and requested that my room be secured in the quiet part of the building. Thanks to her, someone who stayed on the 14th floor was annoyed by the noise but I on the 8th floor had no problem. My overall experience was so delightful that I ended up extending my stay for another night (my company was paying :p) and would come back to the Ames in future.

Reviews.Title: “The best holiday experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Raghav M
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Ames was exemplary. The service was top notch and the amazing staff made us feel at home. A special mention to Allison Harvey (Front Office Supervisor) who was promptly in touch with us prior to our stay via email and all the way until our check out. Rosie at the front desk and the bellman Josh were very friendly as well. We were there for the Christmas weekend celebrating the holidays. The hotel made our stay even more memorable by upgrading us. The hotel's restaurant Woodward was a culinary and drink experience by itself. The cocktails were amazing (my favorite: Green with Envy), and the bartender (Lucas Rozene) was very friendly and gave fantastic local recommendations around town. The restaurant host and servers (esp Nick) were very amiable as well. We stayed for two nights and did not want to leave :), the staff was so friendly that we got to know almost everyone. We loved our stay to the utmost and look forward to returning and staying at the Ames again and again. Thanks to everyone at Ames for such a great Holiday experience :)

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth M
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at the Ames and had a very good experience. The hotel is located in a heritage building but has been renovated in a very sleek and modern style. The room was comfortable and quiet (unlike some other visitors, we didn't hear any noise from the street or subway at all). The location near Faneuil Hall, Boston Common and the Freedom Trail is excellent. A bit pricey for what it is, but if you can get a discounted rate, well worth the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Boston...”
Reviews.Author: aeroplano
Reviews.Content: We traveled with friends to Boston staying at The Ames hotel. We choose this hotel because of its central location to everything.Its a 5 min walk to Faneuil Hall Marketplace. 10-15min walk to North End- Little Italy. And if you don't mind walking 15-20min walk to Beacon Hill area and Charles St (worth checking out). We would stay at the Ames again despite some minor bumps because of the front desk staff (Lindsay) and concierge (Charles) and the location. Our rooms were both on the top floor (15) and the first day there housekeeping arrived about 9am. They quickly left because we were still in the room. They said they would return later to clean. We were site seeing all day returning around 4pm. We discovered that our rooms had not been cleaned, we wanted to relax a bit before dinner. Instead we went to the front desk to let them know. They promptly sent housekeeping after apologizing, but we had to wait almost an hour for the rooms to be cleaned, and when we returned to the room we found that they had done a rushed job. The front desk gave us drink vouchers for Woodwards to make up for the room debacle. We noticed in the night stand drawer there was a note with ear plugs (see pic) , we were perplexed by it but didn't think anything of it until...that same night, around 3:30-4am in the morning we were woken up by loud music and intimate sounds, because the paper thin walls do not keep noise out. This happened again the second night too! Both times Lindsay at front desk was called to which security was promptly sent up. We could even hear the knock on their door! Both times we found a note in the morning under our door apologizing for the noise and vouchers for brunch to Woodwards. Despite the above, we would give Ames another try again. Hopefully the housekeeping mix-up was a one time thing, because the rooms upon arrival were very clean. As for the noise I think better sound proofing walls should be considered. A guest should not be able to hear intimate conversations from another room.

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: DBFBoston
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here and were very impressed. The lobby didn't do much for me - almost seemed like they were trying too hard for the modern minimalist look, but the room was terrific. It was small but very comfortable and the wall between the room and bathroom was glass with a curtain you could pull which gave the small space a bigger feel. Big, deep tub too. And great downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “True Urban Minimalism”
Reviews.Author: Matthew K
Reviews.Content: I elected to stay at the Ames for one night over Thanksgiving weekend. I have family nearby so it was more for fun than true need of shelter, but I thought I would give it a try. The Ames is located basically in the Financial District of Boston, meaning it is centrally located but not in the hipper part of the city. That said, this is Boston so everything is extremely close together. My experience at the Ames was generally very positive. I booked the most basic room, which I found to be nice but not overwhelmingly well appointed. In truth, the space I was given felt like something of a cement box. I entitle this entry "True Urban Minimalism" largely because a minimalist aesthetic can sometimes add up to just that -- very little. I can appreciate how the design of the space was somewhat thoughtful, but in the case of my room it seemed that something was missing. That said, service was terrific. I neglected to bring a few items and they were promptly brought to my room. The following morning, I was informed that room service was unavailable due to an issue in the kitchen. While I was disappointed, an hour later I was brought up a complimentary tray of pastries and juice. While I was about to leave and couldn't actually enjoy them, it was a nice gesture. It must be noted that I booked my room on Last Minute Travel, so I payed only $140 for my room and therefore had lowered expectations of what my experience would be. For what I paid I feel that the experience was Very Good. However, if I had paid more I might have been disappointed, particularly given the austerity of the room. A companion traveler ended up in the next level of accommodation, and his room was not particularly notable either (save for the "sexy" glass shower, which it should be noted is not a feature of the basic room).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dawn A
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here after our wedding for a minimoon. The hotel was gorgeous, the staff was polite and very accommodating. The location was great we were able to walk to quincy Market, little Italy and the Aquarium. The cafe in the restaurant was also delicious and not expensive like some hotel restaurants. We got upgraded to a deluxe suite, it was bigger then we needed but we loved the shades that pulled down blocking all sunlight! Made it easier to sleep alittle later! All in all we would def go back to this hotel! Our only complaint was the the valet was pricey but there really was no where to park!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Modern Hotel Near attractrions!”
Reviews.Author: beachbum426
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my Sisters wedding. So the family had a number of rooms. The suites were gorgeous with the high ceiling and picturesque windows. Rooms were very clean! The smallers rooms were clean, but were cramped for more than 1 person. Overall, great hotel for Boston and right near Faneuil Hal!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: on_cape
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a quick getaway weekend without the kids and enjoyed the property very much. Breakfast at Woodwards was fair but the staff elsewhere was all really nice. Great location, but as others have noted it is noisy on the streets, and we were even on the 14th floor. But, you are in a city so it is to be expected

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: Alexis and Meli... R
Reviews.Content: The Ames Hotel has become our home away from home. We celebrated are wedding week at the Ames, my wife and I stayed at the Ames last year, the exact same weekend of the wedding just so we can have an idea how the weather would be so we could prepare our friend and family from Miami, FL. It has been such a marvelous experience working with Executive Assistant Julie Guerra at the Ames, she made all the arrangements and it was a breeze to coordinate everything with her and the hotel staff. In all honesty, they treated our 28 guests like family, there were no complaints just continued waves of compliments from our guests. The rooms are beautiful, clean and modern. The beds are so yummy, it made it hard to get out of bed some mornings. The location is perfect, take the shuttle at the airport to the blue line, and the blue line to state, the hotel is right across the street, you will get there in less than 10 mins. It's only a short drive from the airport, trust me I made several trips this past week. Faneuil Hall is right next to the hotel with plenty of shops and bars, shopping is just down the street, H&M, Macy's and several other stores are just a couple of blocks away. There are trolley tours that can take you around town. The blue/orange line is on state, and the blue/green government center line is behind the hotel. Since we needed to apply for our marriage license, city hall was just next to the hotel, less than a five minute walk. There are several banks nearby, and CVS if you need water or other essentials. The hotel is in a centralized location, and easily accessible via public transportation. The minute you get out of the car, the most cordial and helpful doormen, like Nick, Brandon, Ralique (I may be butchering the spelling of his name, sorry) and the other gentlemen who took wonderful care of us, greet you with a warm smile. The concierge Charles is phenomenal, he arranged transportation for our guest to the wedding location a few blocks away, and took care of any logistical concerns we had. My mom and my cousins are in love with him, he is just amazing. The front-desk staff, the amazing Rosy, Mary, Alison, Janelle, Frances, Kimberly, and Ben, they are always there to greet you with a smile, and always taking care of your every need. No reasonable request was every denied, we thank you for putting up with us the days leading to the wedding. Housekeeping is always on point the rooms are always spotless, and well-taken care, extra towels and toiletries are provided within minutes of request and always with a smile and pleasantries. We loved Deanna on the 14th floor; she took excellent care of us the whole week, even our dog Lenny is in love with her. Cecelia, I think she is head of housekeeping, she is an angel, she treated our dog like VIP, and the rest of housekeeping were always patient and kind. Downstairs at the Woodward, great service, excellent food, amazing selection of cocktails, beer and wine, Jake was our main server for the week, he and the manager Dana took excellent care of everyone all week. I donâ€™t think we ate breakfast or dinner anywhere else while in town. Everyone was sad to leave the Ames; no one wanted to go back home. We sincerely thank everyone at the Ames and the Woodward for their incredibly hospitality, they made our wedding week memorable and unforgettable. The Rodriguez Wedding Party!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheGeek
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a youthful feel, partly due to its lively bar; but also due to its energetic staff and modern decor. The hotel is difficult to locate, there is no signage out front and the door staff are scruffy and without uniform. Inside however it thankfully changes. Good decor, excellent staff. Although, bathroom was a little dark. Hotel has a small boutique feel. Solid hotel for business or a weekend break. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Ames!”
Reviews.Author: allyt322
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic hotel! There's a few comments here about the high cost - we were lucky to get a brilliant deal on it, but I think I would have paid full price anyway. I also didn't experience some of the noise complaints people have posted about - we never heard any loud noises (well, except when you're down in the lobby), and our room was super quiet. PROS *big, comfy bed *decent sized hotel room - not huge, but very comfortable. BIG bathroom! *the gym was very small but quite good - free weights, towels, etc. *location was ideal - on the edge of the financial district so you didn't have to contend with crowds of tourists, but a very quick walk to everything - and the subway was spitting distance from the front door! *gorgeous hotel. Plain and simple, the hotel felt fancy yet comfortable - very cool. CONS *ummm...I honestly don't have any. Perhaps a slightly bigger gym? If I return to Boston I'd stay at the Ames in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Boston”
Reviews.Author: austin_TexasLkd
Reviews.Content: Great city hotel in a fabulous downtown location, you can walk or take the subway anywhere from this hotel. The warm friendly staff is helpful in every way. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The restaurant is excellent,"The Woodward" go for drinks,eat and enjoy the fun lively crowd. Tip: Ask for Trish, she is the best waitress and the most fun and adorable.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Happy with Ames”
Reviews.Author: julfers
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay (4 nights) at the Ames. I was a little worried based on the reviews here that noise would be an issue. Before arriving I e-mailed the GM asking for a room on a higher floor and quickly got a response from her and one of her staff members (on a Saturday morning). Upon arrival the front desk clerk notified me that we would be on the 14th floor so I was happy to see that they paid attention to my request. The room was great. I didn't find the room too small especially considering the age of the building and the city location. Extra high ceilings and the super large double windows of the 14th floor helped for sure. We found the room to be clean and especially liked the wooden floors and nicely appointed bathroom. The location was also great being very nearby many of the things that we did while in Boston. Things that weren't within walking distance were just a $7-12 cab ride away. I was also happy to see that they airport was just minutes away by cab. Overall we most impressed by the staff's attention to our requests on more than one occasion. The GM, Nina, was great and very responsive to us. I would stay here again without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MMMGirkin
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here for one night. It was very modern, funky and comfortable, great bed and pillows. Nice views, beautiful historic building. The bathroom was beautiful but the shower did leak a little as it was open. Location was great, close to Boston Common and there is a lovely cupcake shop around the corner. Staff were very helpful. If you are a very private person the shower might not be your thing - it is fully glass (you can see through to the room) but can be covered with a curtain.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: evening
Reviews.Content: I loved the Ames! The room and bathroom were so gorgeous and well designed, I was ready to plaguarize the David Rockwell decor and redo my recently renovated apartment. The bathroom was bigger than my kitchen; the bedroom area was a little small, but fine for 1 person used to living in a city apartment. The AC unit whispered - I barely heard it start-up. Minimal street noise. You do hear loud slamming doors from the hallway - and something could be done about this. Chas, the concierge, was helpful about giving me advice of things to do in my down time. Only at breakfast at the hotel once, but it was excellent. My only complaint (other than the loud slamming doors in the hallway) was 1 drawer in the closet! 1 drawer may be fine for a weekend, but not for a 4 night stay. If there were more hangers, I could have lived with just the 1 drawer, but my request for hangers was ignored. The alarm clock was also impossible to figure out, and I really didnt want someone to come to my room to give me a lesson. And, the down pillows were hard as rocks! So, I guess there are really 3 complaints, but the alarm clock was minor because I had my own - and I could have pursued the hanger issue if I really cared.

Reviews.Title: “Designer hotel, quite well located”
Reviews.Author: gootandcat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Overall a good experience, although rather pricey. We arrived Wednesday night and the lobby is located next to the bar/ restaurant area was incredibly lively / noisy - nice if you're in a party mood but a but tiring after a long flight. There seemed to be a helicopter raid going on as well and then later what seemed to be a puppy being tortured in the next room - maybe Wednesdays are just noisy days! Anyway it was fine after that, except there is a homeless refuge next door , although you wouldn't realise it because it looks like a disused bank. However, some of the "residents" hang out on the benches across the street and greet you with the usual things that drunks do - but quite harmless. Minimalist decor, which I like. The room had a high ceiling and was airy. Bed was very comfortable. The only slightly bizarre thing was the bathroom was entirely walled in glass, although there was a modesty net curtain. Not really convinced about that, but it looked quite stylish. It wasn't a wow hotel but only average for the price - stayed in better and cheaper in Canada (eg Soho Metropolitan in Toronto)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: saladi
Reviews.Content: We thought we were in for a real treat when we booked this hotel and it certainly lived up to the pictures. It is a wonderful contemporary remodelling of an historic building in a great location. But - our room was rather small although the high ceilings took the claustrophibic edge off. There were only 2 small drawers in the wardrobe so our suitcases had to stay on the floor which added to the congestion. There was a table and chair, but anything we wanted to use that wouldn't fit into the 2 drawers ended up on the table and added more clutter. There was nowhere comfortable to sit except on the bed. There was a minibar containing some very expensive goodies - a bottle of water was $8. The bathroom was large and looked gorgeous but I wasn't smart enough to work out how the shower controls work - just fiddled about until warm water came out. It was noisy too, especially at 2am when the neighbours turned up! Wifi was free only in the restaurant, which was crowded and noisy any time we went past so we ended up in Starbucks down the road. Overall, we found this to be a wonderfully stylish modern hotel but it just wasn't as comfortable as a couple of Holiday Inns or Best Westerns we stayed in - and at about double their price. Perhaps it would be great for a person travelling alone on business expenses, but not for us.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MsBula
Reviews.Content: Nice room, excellent staff, BUT the subway noise is just too invasive. You cannot sleep with the noise unless you normally live under a flight path in a busy city. Trust me, look elsewhere if you need a good night's sleep. and if you don't believe me and book anyway, don't say you were not warned!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Modern room....”
Reviews.Author: timinla
Reviews.Content: We drove to Boston from Newport RI...the last day of our vacation.....our choice was the Ames Hotel for our last night stay on the East Coast...we've vacationed with the Morgans Hotel Group before and love their Hotels. This was as impressive as the rest....smaller rooms, but very high cielings.....modern baths...glass showers....incredibly comfortable beds.....what more could you ask for....The only thing I didn't like was the Hotel charges for WI-FI access, which I thought petty...I work in the Entertainment Industry, and travel all over the world...and usually the access is free of charge..that's my only complaint.....so I couldn't use my IPad, but still had my IPhone...so all was good!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, cool design, great location”
Reviews.Author: Lagreenwell
Reviews.Content: I've visited the Ames twice for business, and they did great both times. Nice staff, huge rooms, efficient design, nice amenities, and a great location near my office and shopping. The only note for improvement would be the remote. It's a standard hotel remote, but you have to push the channel button so hard, you fingers start really hurting after flipping channels. If that's the worse thing about the place though, that's saying something. Also- the desserts in the restaurant are intense and huge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: jewls74
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, the bed seemed awfully low to the ground, but it was comfy. Love the hardwood floors, shower, and the sit down vanity outside of bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “No need for Norwegian water”
Reviews.Author: palodegolf
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay here. The building is an architectural gem and our room was comfortable and smart. The location is excellent. Although we didn't use it, the restaurant is supposed to be good and got very lively in the evenings. But bottled water from Norway in the room? For 8 bucks it might taste really good, but our carbon footprint is big enough already thanks! The tap water didn't kill us anyway.

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: caisemannfamily
Reviews.Content: I came to Boston to attend meetings, but brought my husband to have a quick weekend retreat. Our room was amazing - simple, streamlined and modern. We spent some time in Woodward (bar/restaurant in Ames) and met some incredibly nice people....the food, drinks and atmosphere were all top notch. While Lauren behind the bar could have been a bit warmer and friendlier overall the service in Woodward was great. Charles the concierge at the Ames was fantastic with restaurant recommendations. I will definitely recommend this hotel to others and will for sure stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ames!”
Reviews.Author: Betty1928
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Ames...it was unfortunately only one night but we didn't want to move out! When we arrived we were delighted to have been upgraded to a bigger suite and were allowed to check in early at only 11:00 a.m., both very welcome bonuses! The room was comfortable and sexy! Loved the linens, the decor, the bathroom products. The location was perfect for our short stay...we were able to fit in several sights within walking distance. My only gripe is the charge for wifi. On the trip that culminated with our night at the Ames we had stayed in remote cabins, chain hotels and crappy motels and they all offered free wifi. Other than that, though, I would thoroughly recommend the hotel and will make it a point to check out others in the Morgan group.

Reviews.Title: “all around great weekend”
Reviews.Author: joni0405
Reviews.Content: I prefer to stay at Morgan hotels when I travel and the Ames lived up their high standards. Everything from the room to service was terrific. My only suggestion would be to park down the street for $20 a day in the public parking then pay the $42 per night at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and high style, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Gail N
Reviews.Content: The Ames hotel is a treat - we had a double bedded room that was stylish and very comfortable with a great view all the way to the Fort Point channel. But the hotel is pricey; be prepared to pay plenty for parking - of course this is the same at all the Boston hotels and parking garages. Better to take a taxi, shuttle or public transport from the airport and walk around or take a taxi if necessary. The hotel also needs to improve the lighting for its magnifying mirror and add some storage for toiletries in its otherwise perfect bathroom. Don't miss the wonderful restaurant - the food is delicious and the drinks are creative and refreshing. Room service for breakfast is prompt with wonderful fresh fruit, coffee and delicious muffins as well as more substantial meals at a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING Experience”
Reviews.Author: derek_moore
Reviews.Content: From the moment my partner and I walked into the Ames, it was clear we were in good hands. The lobby is stylish as is the rest of the hotel; sleek and polished but not fussy. The warmth the front desk employees exude stands in stark contrast to the almost coldly modern lobby. They are so much more effusive and genuine than employees at any other boutique hotel I have stayed in that they're now the yardstick I measure hotel customer service. They were happy to share the PERFECT breakfast joint as well as a scenic route to walk there. The location of the hotel is fantastic: it is located close to Quincy Market and Fanueil Hall and within walking distance to Beacon Hill. Our room was incredibly beautiful with a glass shower that looked out onto the bed. I can't wait for an excuse to go back to Boston so I can stay at the Ames.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Ames”
Reviews.Author: Darryl C
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Ames. I arrived in Boston very early in the morning and was able to check into the room between 9 and 10am the same morning. Considering that check in is normally at 3:00pm, I really appreciated the accomodation. Hotel is very close to lots of the Boston attractions, Quincy Market, with all of the shops and restaurants very nearby. Hotel was very trendy and the decor in the rooms were very nice. Since the hotel is right in the heart, perhaps upgrading the windows so that less sound can be heard might be an option. Keeping in mind that there are no perfect situations, noise, location, control of traffic in busy areas, this hotel far exceeded my standards. My visit to see friends in the Boston area did not go exactly as I would have liked, but the hotel, the staff helped make up for it. Would most definitely stay here again when I come back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Ames”
Reviews.Author: Lucio B
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in one of the nicest places in Boston. The room was large and well furnished. The staff was very friendly. A little bit of noise during the night because of the central position of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Ames hotel: A class act”
Reviews.Author: aadewey
Reviews.Content: We loved our experience at Ames from start to finish. The front desk staff went above and beyond to make us feel welcome, despite our late night check in. They showed us to our incredible upgraded room. We felt like they really cared about making our stay the best possible. The room was classy, clean, and modern. The room service menu was wonderful- we enjoyed a tasty cheese plate. We were able to walk to the North End for a tasty dinner at a fabulous restaurant recommended by the doorman. We will absolutely return to Ames next time we are in Boston. I have already recommended it to friends and family. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: TulsaTraveler0807
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Deluxe Corner King room. We were on the 4th floor It was obnoxiously loud the first night! I read a few other reviews that mentioned it being noisy, but I had no idea it would that bad. We've stayed in other cities this big before, but this is the loudest it's ever been. A white noise machine would really have helped! We were traveling with a baby, and I don't know if the put us there as opposed to a higher floor to keep from disturbing other guests or what. Our room was above the large patio area of the Woodward restaurant which becomes a large, loud bar area on the weekends. We were there on a Sat & Sun night. Sunday night was better, but there were might be a hospital near by because we heard many sirens that night as well. Other than the noise, we loved the hotel. It has a very tendy, modern vibe. It was surprisingly a very child friendly room. The bed was very low, and I liked that the room had hard wood or faux wood floors. You can't beat the location. You are about a 5/10 minute walk from Boston Common on one side and the North End on the other. You're even closer than that to Quincy Market. If you can help it, don't drive in Boston! There are tons of tunnels close to this area, and it's very east to get turned around. We had room service for dirr and lunch one day. The food is from the kitchen of the Woodward restaurant, and it was good. We also walked to Mike's Pastry one morning for cannoli. It was amazing, and you feel a little less guilty about it after all the walking you do in the city. The only other warning is that there is a big homeless shelter right next door to the hotel. The people stay in that area in benches aok around the hotel. We saw them get in a few fights in the two days we were there. I wouldn't have felt comfortable walking around there at night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel in the heart of Boston!”
Reviews.Author: jeanneKoz
Reviews.Content: We took a chance with a last minute reservation through the "HotelTonight" app (very good btw). The Ames exceeded our expectations in every category. Clean, spacious and beautiful room and bath. The staff was very friendly esp. the concierge who easily determined the best places to dine near our venue. The bed was so comfortable that I did not want to leave. The bathroom is very cool (!) with the shower wall made of glass which overlooks the bedroom (if u keep the sheer curtain open)... Definitely will be visiting the Ames again...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Modern Design”
Reviews.Author: willngrace
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ames for the night, definitely would stay again. It's in a great location and not too far to get to via the subway from the airport. The room was modern and nicely designed just like I like it. The only slight complain I would have is the tub in the bathroom was ridiculously high! You really have to step up to get into the bath tub. The decor in the rooms was lovely, very modern and sleek. Rooms were very clean and the bath products offered were nice. A plus is the free wi-fi service which I didn't have any problems using. Had breakfast in the hotel restaurant which was quite good. Staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lazo2310
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. Very modern and walking distance to everything. There is a subway stop just behind the hotel but we didn't use it as everything is so close. The room was a good size and very nice and bathroom modern and clean. The staff were friendly and provided great tips for places to eat. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Very design hotel but with poor services”
Reviews.Author: spcfrancis
Reviews.Content: Hotel very design and cozy, very well located. However the services are very poor. No one came to clean the room (at least do the bed), the only thing they did was to replace a bottle of water (a 8 USD!!!)... When I told this to the reception, they looked surprised but did nothing. Restauration services (for breakfast) are very expensive and not up the standards. You're better off going somewhere else. I ended up with orange juice all over me as the server drop it in the middle of the table. It is a shame that the services are not up the standard of the hotel, which is really nice. Management should improve on this point.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with central location and great service”
Reviews.Author: PhilaTraveler22
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of my favorite hotels to stay at, not only in Boston but anywhere. I travel to Boston for work but have also chosen this hotel when traveling on my own dime. Rooms are a good size and decorated well. Comfy beds, great shower. The staff is friendly and helpful if you need directions or recommendations. You also great great bath products and on occasion I've been surprised by cookies and milk delivered to my room!

Reviews.Title: “Best downtown location, great rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: derflop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ames in August for five nights and we really enjoyed our stay there. We were warmly welcomed by the always-friendly staff and it didn't take even two minutes to get us checked in after a exhausting long-haul flight. The room was quiet, spacious and very good value for the money. Staff was also very helpful and patient when we wanted to go to Martha's Vineyard and hadn't booked the ferry in advance. So everything was perfect. If I have to find a negative then it's the $10 they charge for wireless internet access per day. I think today wireless should be complementary, especially in a hip place like this! But most importantly: you can't beat the location. The Ames Hotel is located in, well, the Ames Building (btw. that's the only hint you'll have when looking for it - there's no sign whatsoever at the door or on the street!) which is just across the road from Old State House. Farneuil Hall is a 2-minute walk. Very convenient for sightseeing! Overall, we can absolutely recommend the Ames. We will definitely stay there again when we're in Boston again. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: RincenaTravel
Reviews.Content: Great value, location, and standard. Call first to make sure that there is no construction going on outside. I'm laying awake because 24 hour construction is happening outside my window. So loud!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and awesome weekend”
Reviews.Author: lisaks300
Reviews.Content: The weekend started with a friendly valet who whisked away our car so we had no worries about parking in downtown Boston. We were greeted at the door with a smile and every staff member we interacted with was very friendly and accommodating. Our room was at the top floor. It was immaculately clean as was the entire hotel. The bed was comfortable, the room was large as was the bathroom. We were very satisfied with the accommodations. We had breakfast at the hotel on both days and really enjoyed the unique menu. It was just a great weekend getaway!! Can't wait to do it again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Class”
Reviews.Author: MonacoRouguetrooper
Reviews.Content: Best Breakfast's I've ever tasted in a hotel. Converted Old Building done tastefully, excellent Location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: travelmomABC
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed very comfortably in the One Bedroom Suite. The room was beautiful with its clean look and modern design, yet at the same time I never felt that functionality was sacrificed. We stayed for 6 nights, so it was great to have a separate living and sleeping area each with its own TV, as well as a separate powder room. There is also a good-sized dining table and plenty of counter space. It was almost like staying in a really chic apartment. Location really is great, walking distance to many points of interests. We could see the Old State House from our room window! Lots of people have mentioned the hotel's proximity to Quincy Market, North End, and the New England Aquarium. I'd also add Chinatown. Although our room was located relatively low on the 3rd floor, we did not really have problems with the noise from the restaurant/bar or street level. The only complaint I have is that we can hear the subway rumbling underneath. And this can be extremely disruptive early in the morning. Other than that a really nice stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Comfort In The Heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: nyc333
Reviews.Content: My husband myself and a second couple enjoyed our stay in this upscale boutique hotel located within easy walking distance of all Boston attractions.The property was well appointed and ultra cool. I contacted the hotel manager, Nina Sweet, prior to our stay and let her know that our trip was a special one for the four of us. Upon our arrival we were greeted by a welcoming and professional staff as well as being treated to a complimentary upgrade. I as well as my traveling companions were keenly impressed with staff at all times. The uber contemporary surroundings may not suit all travelers but we found it to be a well appointed comfortable property. I would not hesitate to recommend the Ames to anyone especially those who wish to take advantage of its super location in the heart of all that Boston has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Totally fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Vicki_C72
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, in a great location, with great staff! We couldnâ€™t fault our stay at the Ames. It has most welcoming and helpful staff, Mary on the front desk was really great, who help give the place a really nice relaxed vibe. The hotel is immaculately presented with fab dÃ©cor. Breakfast, and in particular the pancakes, is a real treat. Our room was huge with fantastic views, a very comfy bed and overall very well equipped. Itâ€™s also in a perfect location for getting around the city. We'll definitely be back next time we go to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic boutique hotel experience without details in special occasions”
Reviews.Author: ViajerosMAD
Reviews.Content: +One fantastic boutique hotel experience. The staff was incredible Friendly and helpful. They offfered us to pay an upgraded with better price in the check-in to a Deluxe King room and it was massive and beautiful. +Location excellent, close to financial center, historic Boston and Quincy market. The Blue line t station is right across the hotel's front door. + The rooms were very nice, spacious, the bed was very comfortable. We really enjoyed the overall modern design. Bathroom and closet excellent. With a high level of finishes, furniture and facilities. + The food at the Woodward restaurant was great. -Poor attention in details as expected, because it was a special occasion for us and they hadnÂ´t got any detail with us. We would stay at the Ames again and will recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a great place!”
Reviews.Author: jkrompegel01
Reviews.Content: Can't tell you what a nice place, super people and great location the Ames is. From the front desk to the maids and everyone in between were just great. The rooms were a thing of beauty, and squeaky clean. And finally, the location, oh my God. You are right on the Freedom Trail in the heart of it all. Kudos Ames, you made us all very, very happy!

Reviews.Title: “A modern room in an old city”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaGATrvlr
Reviews.Content: good location,friendly staff at check in. check in and check out were both a breeze. Great shower and room amenities. Wireless access was not increase with my room package. Comfortable and quiet room. I found this hotel on jetsettet and was pleased with the result. Did not try the restaurant or bar. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Gem!”
Reviews.Author: mcmomny
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night while in Boston. Perfect location to walk to shopping and nightlife. One block from the subway Rooms look just like the web page! Really neat, very clean and very high end toiletries. The rooms are on the small side but just fine for two. Comfortable bed and nice shower pressure. Did not experience or hear hallway noise. Honor bar is very pricey, bought water and snacks at mini mart right next door for alot less! Check in was very friendly and helpful, but didn't want to ask the concierge for advice as he seemed rather abbrasive! Listened to him ridicule a woman who questioned him about the cost of Yankee/Red Socks tickets. Even the front desk gave him a look! Had breakfast there, excellent! Great, friendly service, really good choices for breakfast and not very expensive! Can't beat the cost, parking and location! We will stay here again on our next trip to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Hip, cool, convenient and comfortable!!!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyDad89
Reviews.Content: The environment and vibe here is clearly geared a bit more to the younger set. Very modern, European feel but with hints of old-world architecture. Great location. Friendly staff, very comfortable rooms. The bar is quite active in the evenings, filled with trend-setting professional types.

Reviews.Title: “This family loved the Ames”
Reviews.Author: azrunbunny
Reviews.Content: We stayed with children, age 2 and 5. The deluxe double double had ample room for play, and allowed us to sequester the crib out of view of our bed. The staff was attentive to our every need. Laundry service was prompt (they even wash carseat covers.) Location can't be beat, between 3 T stops, at the door step of Faneuil hall. all in all a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: aguvenis
Reviews.Content: We have spend 4 nites at Ames last month and very pleased with the location , staff and service. First of all; if you are for financial center or Freedom Trail you can not ask for a better place, located a blok from Faneuil Market the hotel is 10 min away from Logan Airport (by a cab, or subway) , the blue line T station is across from the front door and the Green line T station is next corner , what can you ask for more ?. The elegant first skyscraper of Boston has decorated with minimalist taste. The lobby is like an art gallery decorated with few but tastefull modern objects. We have stayed on the 14th floor and although in one of the smaller rooms (what we have understood from floor plans posted in rooms) facing financial center, our deluxe king room was spacious. Smartly decorated room with contemporary furniture, offers the confort of home, high ceilings letting lots of light in. The modern designed bathroom is large and functional, complete with fullfy towels, upscale toiliteries, powerful hair dryer, lit magnifying vanity mirror and dimmer lite which comes handy at nite when visiting the bathroom. The mini bar and snack tray has a good and wide variety of choices. Iron, radio, umbrella naming few more little yet thoughtful touches to add. We were on the 14th floor so the noise from outside was not disturbing. The hotel has a small yet well equipped gym along with a bussiness center. The elevators are a bit small yet fast, the lounge on the first floor is decorated comfortably. The Woodward restaurant by the entrance, popular by financial district employees, has a very good bar along with good food. We have enjoyed the tasteful breakfasts. The staff was always helpful , friendly and prompt, with a positive approach for every demand, solution focused, like providing umbrella's for everyone of us when it started pouring , printing driving directions, grabing a cab what ever is needed. Overall the hotel with its location and staff is a very good choice for accomodation and well worth the price I would highly recommend Ames.

Reviews.Title: “My room was too hip for the room"”
Reviews.Author: dolceandsandy
Reviews.Content: Black hallways. Clear bathroom walls, with shower curtains providing the privacy. Yikes. This funky Boston hotel was well appointed but come on, people. Seriously? And the tub? I needed a ladder to crawl into the shower. I would give this hotel props for trying to appeal to the business hipsters, but stay away if you are claustrophobic because the rooms are fairly small. Thumbs up for room service, who gives you a call when the order is on its way. That was something that almost never happens. And the barkeep in the restaurant was cheery and chatty during our late night snack of lobster roll and chowdah. It did take us several phone calls to find our luggage after check in, but the valet service was speedy and polite. Location in the financial district isn't the best (unless your business day takes you there), but it is walking distance to the much diminished Quincy Market area. Will I return?Probably not. I like my room plush and inviting. This was too stark and weird for my tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Idea Location, Swanky Hotel and the Most Pleasant Staff Ever”
Reviews.Author: Fralfred
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ames for 3 evenings in August. We couldnâ€™t have picked a better hotel. The location is ideal. We left our car and traveled by foot to all of the sites. I felt comfortable walking back to the hotel in the evening as the neighborhood was very safe. The hotel itself is sleek and modern while the rooms are comfortable, clean and quiet. Contrary to comments from another reviewer, our room was a good size and well appointed - complete with light dimmers, rain shower head and vanity table and bench. We had breakfast twice as well as a nightcap at their restaurant The Woodward. On all occasions the service, food and drinks were exceptional. The mushroom and truffle hash and blueberry pancakes are decadent! Their music selection was great but not loud at all. I must also mention how helpful, friendly and professional the staff at the Ames was. Weâ€™ve travelled quite a lot and I have never experienced a stay at a hotel where the staff was consistently pleasant. We were greeted with a smile regardless of our requests or questions for all three days. What a difference a smile makes! Stay at the Ames â€“ you wonâ€™t be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alyssa_B25
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed in May 2011 for a long weekend. We were able to check-in early and found our room to be very nice and clean. This hotel is in a great central location and within walking distance to many sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location on the Freedom Trail”
Reviews.Author: ChrisH3040
Reviews.Content: The Ames Hotel is a modern, trendy, comfortable, plush hotel. It is located next to the Freedom Trail, right across the Street from the Old State House and the site of the Boston Massacre. The beds are extremely comfortable and the bathrooms spacious. The only negatives about our stay were the A/C's inconsistency (which we reported to management upon departure as it was chilly during our stay) and the lack of bathroom counter space. Those minor problems were more than made up by the large flat screen TV, the free in room safe, the free WiFi and the spectacular views. The restaurant at the Ames serves really tasty food and the entire staff at this hotel was friendly, helpful and accommodating. We loved having a friendly doorman who assisted us when we were dealing with umbrellas during part of our stay! We will definitely return to this hotel on our next visit to Boston

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Joanna G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ames for 3 days, we loved it. Everything was great! I emailed the manager earlier asking for an early check in which was not a problem, she was waiting for me and when I told her what my last name was she already knew who I was, which made me feel like she really cared. Everyone was so nice and friendly. The hotel room was great, so was the restaurant. I can't wait to come back to Ames. Next time I am in Boston, I will stay at Ames. If you are looking for a great place to stay, Ames should be your choice! The manager - Nina, such a great person! I honestly can't wait to go back to Ames!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as other Morgan gp hotels”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetterandfoodie
Reviews.Content: Room was small and noisy due to street construction. Front desk was accomodating and did a room change, but no upgrade. Overall, would Not return, stay at the w hotel, for a better bar and restaurant with better rooms and amenities. Gym was really small too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinGina
Reviews.Content: Ames is centrally located right on the Freedom Trail with easy access to both "coasts" of Boston. The location was very perfect for us - the city felt safe even when we walked after dark. There will be city noises - sirens, the occasional loud person, but we loved it! The staff at the Ames were very accommodating and friendly. Especially try to take advantage of their wonderful concierge Charles - he's definitely the man to get you what you need. You rock, Charles! Thank you, Ames, for 8 comfortable days! Couple notes: * Beds/rooms are wonderful, clean and simple * Expect small elevators - a wheelchair will fit, but not easily! * The restaurant food is delicious but not for regular ordering - too expensive and a little too fancy for eating often. * Do NOT take a taxi from the Airport...the subway blue line will let you out steps away from the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Spunkygal007
Reviews.Content: After reading the many positive reviews of the Ames Hotel, I decided to book it for a surprise anniversary trip for my boyfriend and me. The staff at the Ames, and the hotel itself, FAR exceeded my expectations. We were coming on July 4th, a very busy day for Boston, so I made sure to email Nina, the hotel manager, a few days before arrival to make sure everything was confirmed for our check in. She replied quickly and showed a ton of personal attention and wished my boyfriend and I a pleasant stay during our impending anniversary. This was just the beginning of the exemplary service we received at the Ames. Upon arrival in Boston, we went straight to the Ames, which was in an ideal location. Less than a ten minute walk from the train station, and only steps away from everything in the heart of the city. Quincy Market/Fanueil Hall was across the street! Boston Commons were a few blocks over! Even the North End was only a short walk! My guy and I didn't need to use public transit ONCE on our trip and we went EVERYWHERE and did everything someone in Boston would want to do. Perfect location. The hotel was also mentioned on our duck tour for being the tallest building in Boston before steel (etc) was used for skyscrapers. We felt awesome that our hotel was such a great landmark! The hotel is very modern. It's very swanky, sexy, minimalist and contemporary in design. Walking in, we both gasped at how beautiful it was. We were three hours early for check out, but the nice man who checked us in said we could go to our room early, and handed up brochures listing all of the July 4th activities, which was nice. We ended up in a corner suite, which I'm sure was Nina's doing after my email. What a spectacular (and much appreciated) surprise! After coming back from a few hours of sight seeing, a knock was heard on the door. Room service had come to bring a bottle of champagne for us, accompanied by a hand written note from Nina wishing us a fabulous stay and a happy anniversary. I've never seen such spectacular customer service at a hotel. As if I couldn't be knocked out of the park enough, this put it over the top! The sheets and bed were SO comfy. The room is decorated in such a relaxing way, we spent one afternoon just in the room (drinking our anniversary champagne!) because it was so pleasant to be in! Giant TV as well! The shower was HUGE with a rainwater shower head. The Ames also had, by far, the best toiletries I've ever used in a hotel. Fantastic quality products. We also loved using the towel heater. The room/hotel was exquisite, the service outstanding, and Nina and her staff made it certain that the Ames is the only hotel in Boston we will stay at when we return! It was such a memorable trip because of these special touches only a truly exceptional hotel knows how to provide. THANK YOU, NINA!

Reviews.Title: “I sent the hotel this email/review when they asked on their survey and never heard back or even got a confirmation.”
Reviews.Author: myhusbandpacks
Reviews.Content: Overall, I think the hotel is very cool and welcoming. Love the music in the elevator/lobby. The music in the bar was deafening and couldn't hear each other speak. This is not a dance club. Which is why we (8 of us) retreated to a friends' room where we put on an iPod (a bit loud at first but then lowered it and eventually shut it as someone complained). We kept our voices low after the complaint and again, there was a knock at the door to quiet us. This was at midnight on a Sat. night and your bar was not welcoming at all.
