We were speaking in normal tones when a third time knock came and we were all escorted out by not 1, not 2, but 3 security people who acted as if we were in there with coke and hookers. It was completely ridiculous. We are all over 40, professionals and responsible people who at the most had 1 or 2 drinks at your bar. Which brings me to earlier at the bar when I asked for a Stoli Razberi and soda he just said no. I said, OK, I'll have any raspberry vodka and he shortly said we don't have raspberry vodka. I said, what flavors DO you have? Exasperated, he says blueberry and orange. I said I'll have orange then. SOooo not the way to get a drink order in my opinion. He was very haughty and impatient and it was not crowded. I also have to mention that our room was the tiniest I have seen outside of London. Our friends who were upgraded to a suite paid less than we did originally and we had your smallest room. Strange. I wish I had more room to write aboutnicerthings! (character limit here) That posted, it IS a neat looking place in a beautiful building. Fab huge bathroom and funky touches like Ben Franklin's pic inside the safe. But I wouldn't recommend it overall.

Reviews.Title: “Appears flawless, but scratch the surface.......”
Reviews.Author: Kathrynp
Reviews.Content: Now, you may read this and call me a pedant. But when I go on holiday, I research thoroughly, and expect the places I have chosen to stay to be of a standard. Clean, a good night's sleep, where you're provided with certain levels of comfort with no nasty surprises. Unfortunately, Ames has failed to delivered on three of four of these criteria. But you'd never know it from the website. So 1). It's clean (phew), but so are lots of other hotels in Boston. For a lot less wonga. 2). A good night's sleep? Hmmmm. If you call being woken up by blaring police sirens five times a night "a good night's sleep", then yes it was. But it's the perfect central location by day, so you make sacrifices. 3). Certain levels of comfort. Call me old-fashioned, but I like nothing better than snuggling up in a complimentary dressing gown after my shower. But no, sorry, No dressing gown, no slippers, not even two towels per person (1.5 each, you work out how you share that soggy third towel!) And finally 4) the nasty surprises. If you, like me, rely on the internet when you travel, you'll be kindly relieved of 10 dollars a day for the privelege. And the real rub (and the thing that broke this camel's back) is the water neatly placed on your bedside table. "VOSS, water from Norway" it tells me. Alongside a sticker that proclaims a charge of $8. "Maybe it's magical water" I think. Until I go to the Mini Mart 54 seconds away (I timed it, and that walk was in heels, mildly intoxicated and stopping at traffic lights). The very same magical, Norwegian water was $1.99 just 54 seconds away. Someone please tell me if I'm being pedantic now?! The hotel is beautiful, the breakfast outstanding, the service friendly and the location second to none. Would I stay here again? Probably. Do I feel ever-so-slightly like I've been had? Perhaps.

Reviews.Title: “Little hard to find, but a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DFWfamily2011
Reviews.Content: So we circled the block a couple of times before we decided that the building marked "One Ames" must be the Ames Hotel. We unfortunately arrived when both valet and doorman were inside or away from front. So just know the front of the hotel is very unassuming. That said - it was a great stay - parking was $60 (but it is Boston), very nice staff, comfortable bed and pillows, very modern yet inviting, and best of all the location is superb if you want to explore the North End, Quincy Market/Faneuil Hall, Boston Commons/Public Gardens areas with Blue/Orange lines basically across the street at State Street and Blue/Green lines at Government Center a block in the other direction.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, a little loud”
Reviews.Author: NYCmom50
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business one night in February. It is a beautiful modern designed hotel. I had two issues, first, the noise from the bar scene is a little loud on a Sunday night. Second, the room door didn't lock properly, something I discovered at the end of my stay. Other than that issue (! Maintenance was dispatched promptly upon discovery), it was clean and pleasant. I actually liked watching TV while I showered (the shower is a glass enclosed room within a room). There was no bathtub, which was not a problem for me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, chic hotel--if you can find it.”
Reviews.Author: JohnHenry425
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights here last week, on the 15th floor. Chic, sleek and modern but lacks any signage. My Boston friends passed by it twice! Great staff all around though, with kudos for the doormen.. The bathroom was a magazine photo dream. If I had to nitpick, they could put a light over the bathroom sink. It was like shaving in the dark. I am an early riser and the hotel restaurant opens later than I would have thought. But...I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Very well run hotel, minor flaws?”
Reviews.Author: RSBJGB
Reviews.Content: First, I'll get a few minor negatives out of the way. The Morgans group needs to invest in a sign above/near the main entrance. If you are not familiar with the location, you could do as we did and drive past it twice. Some signage is a practical necessity and doesn't dampen the hip factor. There should also be an investment for a larger workout room. The present space has decent equipment, however it is more like a workout closet than a room. It felt cramped to me and I was in it alone. For many guests, a useable workout facility is important. This one needs enlargement. My final complaint is a petty one and pertains to the hotel bar. For the most part, the hotel bar is a very nice feature - well designed and solid bartending. (The upstairs space was closed for an event when I was there.) I had two drinks during my stay - one was amazing (best Manhattan I've ever had) and the other was disappointing. The let down was a Maccallan 12 yr scotch I ordered that was literally measured out to exactly a shot. Not a drop more. I expect to be charged city, hotel prices, but hate a weak pour. Stick with the mixed coctails, or beer/wine. Enough of the negatives, none of which would prevent from returning to this stylish, very well run hotel. You need to appreciate contemporary style, but if you do you will love the decor and design of the hotel. That said, the service is what stood out to me the most. From the valet, to the front desk personnel, to the conceirge, all were well trained, friendly, and as good as anyone you see at top properties. We stayed in a standard room, which was not large, but the bed/bedding was great and the bathroom was well designed. For our purposes, the location was also very good. I would recommend this place to anyone, with a few caveats mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Silly pricing for very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: lwilson1313
Reviews.Content: The first room we were shown - a quote superior Queen - was very small andn had two Queen beds in it. NO space to move around once suitcases were opened. Maybe 12x20. Asked and received an upgrade from a very courteous staff at the front desk. Room layout was again an issue - particularly the sleeping area - but workable. Bottom line is one is being asked to pay a high premium for kitch.

Reviews.Title: “i couldn't fault this place”
Reviews.Author: grassgrowing
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The deal i got gave free breakfasts from the restaurant downstairs - which were brilliant. I took a ride on the complimentary bicycles. The staff were friendly. The location is ideal for wandering around town. It was about a 20 minute walk to MIT. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SurreyTraveller58
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Ames (room 1406) and it was very nice. Stylish, comfortable, super amenities, incredible mini bar, but no in-room no coffee maker, and not helped by the fact that the coffee at breakfast was from a flask and (to be truthful) luke warm. The bar was a nice place to end the evening with a cocktail, sitting on the terrace. Yes - would certainly go back provided they heat up the coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Funky!”
Reviews.Author: Cardinal2010
Reviews.Content: This narrow downtown hotel is a feast for the eyes! We just loved the modern decor, funky art and comfortable, high-end features. The bathroom was spacious with a towel-warmer, the mini-bar was stocked with gourmet treats and other surprises, the bed was low to the ground with a faux-fur throw over the edge. The staff was very accomodating: a sturdy crib was promptly brought to the room for our 14-month-old at no extra charge. They were also kind enough to retrieve our toddler's meal, heat it up in the kitchen, and return it to us with a spoon and a doily. I was impressed. You can't beat the location, so close to historic and touristic sights. You will not be disappointed by this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable yet Chic”
Reviews.Author: mtnbicycler
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before traveling, but nothing really did this hotel justice. Located right in the heart of downtown, across from Government Center it was the nicest hotel in the city I think I have stayed in. Everything is very upscale and visually striking, with great a great view of the city from our room. Nice features to mention: heated towel bars, water saving features, modern wall art, and tall ceilings! Hope to be able to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Historical Building with perfect modern Boutique Hotel inside”
Reviews.Author: tripdictator
Reviews.Content: In the very, very centre, only a few steps from the subway station Government Center with direct connection to Logan Airport which is only an 8 minutes trip away Carefully renovated historical building with fantastic rooms including impressing bathroom. Very friendly staff, great restaurant. The owners did spend a lot of money to make a deluxe boutique Hotel with all possible comfort including iPod docking station and the biggest offer of a minibar that I have ever seen. They did really put everything in your room you may ever need when traveling including aspirine and world adapter When in Boston I would always stay at the Ames again and can highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sbe123
Reviews.Content: The Ames is a great hotel. The location is at the corner of Washington shopping strip, about a 10 minute walk from Newbury/Boyalston shopping strip, about 10 minute walk to North End restaurant strip and right in the middle of the Financial District. In short, if you are staying in Boston for pleasure or work, there is no better location. The Ames is a small, boutique hotel located in a really pretty building - apparently the originators of the Farmers Almanac once resided here - but the inside has been completely refurbished in really funky, groovy decor. Our room was fantastic with a really lovely view down Washington Street. We stayed for 5 nights at Ames and it was really, really great. I had room service one night as my husband was yet to arrive and the food and service was impeccable. We both had a drink one night in the restaurant before going to dinner and then breakfast the following day and both experiences were fabulous! All the staff at the hotel are just brilliant - especially Nina, Francis, Julie, Mary, Derek, Brendan and Alison. Everybody was so helpful and so full of knowledge about Boston, restaurants, shopping, directions, everything! I am a corporate travel agent and cannot recommend this hotel highly enough to corporate travellers or to leisure travellers. Thank you Ames for a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “So Special”
Reviews.Author: bealight
Reviews.Content: I left feeling "so special". While the hotel is chic and beautiful its the people that make this place so charming. I was there with 2 friends celebrating my birthday on a 4 night weekend. From the front desk greeting upon arrival to checking out, everyone smiled, laughed and took the time to pass on a great feeling. We took advantage of the loaner bikes they provide and biked all around Boston one day, SO MUCH FUN AND SAFE! The hotel restaurant Woodward is AWESOME! the food is so good but again the service and staff is the best. They were not just a day maker, but a trip maker. Thanks so much Ames, you were all great!

Reviews.Title: “we loved our stay at the Ames, can't wait to come back.”
Reviews.Author: Alexis and Meli... R
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Ames so much we made it the host hotel for our wedding in November 2011. The service was impecable from check in to check out, everyone was very accomodating. The room was gorgeous with such an amazing view. Room service was great, but its better to just eat downstairs at the Woodward, the food is delicious. If the weather is chily, we recommend you get a shot of Harlem. We will back in August to finalize the wedding plans, and I must say the management has been graciously accomodating all our needs and wants. Our guests are thrilled with the rates and look forward to the wedding later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Great People, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dmochon
Reviews.Content: I flew in on the red eye across country. Immediately I was greeted by outstanding front desk service, even though it was 6:00 am, the front desk got me into an amazing room right away. Considering the entire state had begun descending upon Boston for the Bruins Parade, this was no small feat. From the time I arrived until the time I left, everyone who I encountered while working there provided a smile, an interest in what I was doing, provided insider tips into some of Boston's hidden gems, and always checked to make sure everything from transportation to the tours we took were was going well. The hotel is spotless, chic, and up to date, while managing a cozy and intimate feeling. The fact that you are literally in the middle of the city and can walk from Back Bay to Beacon Hill was also a selling point

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not luxurious enough”
Reviews.Author: jeminab
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel mainly because of it's position - close to the Freedom Trail; the waterfront and markets; the T and Avis (to collect our rental car). The welcome was good and the room was quiet and looked good. The walk in shower was very stylish but hard to use and water went all over the bathroom floor. I agree with another reviewer that the air con shouldn't be set so low. We were amazed to find that the bottle of water in the room cost $8+ tax, a ridiculous price for something that surely ought to be provided free, especially with temperatures in the 90's. There were no robes or slippers and although the shampoo was OK there was no shower cap (fairly essential in a drencher shower if you don't want to wash your hair at every shower) or additional lotions to make you feel pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TJED1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ames for 5 nights in May 2011, we booked via the hotels website and got a good deal by booking in Advance. I contacted Nina before we arrived to request a quiet room, this request was met on arrival and from our room on the 7th floor which was clean and modern we could not hear the road or 'T' noise noted in some other reviews. All the staff were friendly and knowledgeable, Charles the Concierge was excellent and very helpful for directions, red sox tickets and restaurant recommendations. If you eat breakfast at Woodwards, try the sourdough blueberry pancakes - amazing. The location is great for exploring by foot, within a few minutes you are in the heart of the historic section of the city. When we return to Boston we will definitely return to the Ames.

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous Morgans experience”
Reviews.Author: KSham
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Morgans the weekend of the Bruins vistory parade ! That was just coincidence, but it made for a memorable weekend. Ames is everything I have come to know and love about the Morgans brand: friendly and genuine staff, clean & stylish rooms, great locations in awesome cities, and usually a delicious and/or hip restaurant or bar on the property. Ames has all of these, and I feel like I am just repeating myself every time I write a review for one of these spots: I loved the staff (the front desk was VERY accomodating of my early arrival, and the servers in the restaurant - Woodward - were all fabulous ... the room was gorgeous, comfortable, and clean, as always. There really wasn't anything that I DIDN'T like about this hotel ... oh, and the location is the BEST in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, reasonably priced, excellent central location”
Reviews.Author: Gacn2j
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located to access all of the city centre's attractions. It is only a few minutes walking from the harbor, north end restaurants and Boston common. There is a great bar attached to the hotel and the staff are friendly and attentive. At less than $200 per night, we would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: JMCToronto
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of stying at the Ames Hotel in Boston. Aside from being walking distance to literally "everything", the hotel is a great re-fit of a venerable old building in Boston. Everything from my room, to the service, door staff, room service etc was excellent. If I was going to make a suggestion, I found the hotel restaurant food a bit pricey for what is was......but hey when your on a solo weekend away to get over a break-up....you really don't think about money so much. The hotel is over a year old, and all white rooms (which mine was) can look shabby quickly, but everything was in great condition. My room had a huge tub seperated from the sleeping area by a glass wall.....it was all very dramatic and very worth the price! Boston is a great city to travel to for a weekend away, and I will be returning to the Ames. It is my first stay in a Morgan Hotel.....I usually stay at the "Standard Hotel" in New York, but the Boston trip has me wanting to check out the new Morgan Hotel in Soho.

Reviews.Title: “A Cool Yuppie Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VonWoogle
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in May 2011. We booked by contacting Nina Sweet directly at the hotel and she quickly responded by providing us with a good rate, a room upgrade and a couple of drinks at their very trendy bar. From Nina on down, the staff were pleasant, young, professional. The building is a heritage structure, the tallest building in Boston in the early 20th century, that has been lovingly restored and transformed into a very cool, modern hotel. The room we had (deluxe king) was large, with hardwood floors and bare, cream walls in the bedroom, slate floors and dark pewter grey in the bathroom: the sort of minimalist design that tends to scream "yuppie." But the bed was very comfortable, the location in the centre of town perfect for exploring Boston on foot or accessing the "T" (the MBTA subway system). My only complaints are small ones: a coffee maker would have been appreciated; and, the lack of lighting over the bathroom sink made shaving a bit tricky. (There is a small, lit make-up mirror but I found it difficult to use comfortably.) Boston is an expensive city, and if Nina can help you out with the price, the Ames is a very cool place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Stay”
Reviews.Author: broadfi2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Cub/ Red Sox Series and enjoyed it very much. Getting to the hotel could not of been easier as you are no more than 20 steps from the Old State House (State Stop on 'T'). Check in was quick eventhough we were 3 hours early. The safe in our room was broke but they fixed it while we were out doing touristy stuff. Did I mention that you are less than 20 steps from the 'T' and 2 minutes from Quincy Market/ Faniell Hall, etc. Charles the Conceirge (aka C.T.C.) was excellent and very helpful for stops to get some snacks and directions. However, the WiFi was not free and for the price I figure they might have it thrown in with the $300+ room fee. Also there is no exhaust fan in the modern designed bathroom so that was annoying after a shower. The bathroom was very sexy with the glass opening and open to the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Central location and very modern”
Reviews.Author: simon-pske
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central in Boston. Directly situated near the old town house. The rooms are furnished very modern and equipped with HD TV. Everything was clean and the stuff was helpful in all belongings. We can highly recommand this hotel for business as well as for holiday trips to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Too Noisy”
Reviews.Author: MMusing
Reviews.Content: You can hear the "T" (Boston's subway) rumbling loudly. Heavy doors slam loudly. Nearby construction grinds away during the day. Cute minimalist rooms are no substitute for equally minimalist soundproofing. Unless you like to wear earplugs to bed and are immune to vibrating beds that don't require 25 cents to activate, go elsewhere. Oh, and parking is more than $40 per night. Ouch!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: curlyjen
Reviews.Content: The Ames hotel is great! The location is really good...near Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market. It is also very close to North End. The hotel is modern, clean, and historic. The building is the first skyscraper in Boston. The hotel doesn't have a sign announcing its name and presence. The words "Ames Building" are just above the entry chiseled into the stone. All of the hotel staff are helpful and nice. We loved staying at this hotel and plan to stay there again during our next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: ScreamyFrassy
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights (10th floor, Corner King) and we loved it. Was a bit of a splurge at the price range, but it was worth every penny. Modern touches might not appeal to some, though. Staff were wonderful! And the Woodward, what an amazing dinner experience! A little pricey, but you pay for what you get--food and drinks quality that I doubt will be matched any time soon, and our server was fabulous. The location could not be better, right in front of the Freedom Trail near Quincy Market and the waterfront. I will return to Boston, and I'll stay at the Ames again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: VegasTinks
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Ames. This hotel is in a great location. Right in the heart of Boston. Most things are within a half mile of the hotel. If something isn't within walking distance the subway is right across the street to take you where you need to go. So overall, the location was great. The staff there were all very friendly and outgoing to make it our experience at the Ames great. As we checked in, we were the only ones checking in so the lady at the front desk took some extra time to go through the map and show us the locations of the sites we wanted to see. Since this was our first time to Boston, that was a big help, letting us know how close everything was. That got us off to a great start. Also, since we were on vacation, we slept in and didn't get going until later in the morning so housekeeping had already finished our floor. We let the front desk know and each day after that housekeeping stopped by later in the day for our room. Everyone that we spoke with from the Ames was very friendly and outgoing, making for a great stay. The decor was very modern, simple and elegant. We were in a King Room and the actual space was adequate, but with the high ceilings and large windows it felt much bigger. The hardwood floors were a really nice touch. Also, everything was spotless in our room. That along with a really comfortable bed made the Ames a perfect spot to come back to each night. There was some city noise, we noticed a few ambulances going by each night, but with this being in the middle of a big city that is to be expected. We were able to take advantage of a discount by prepaying for our room a few months in advance. By doing that the price of the Ames was less than other comparable hotels in the surrounding area. Overall, with the location, the staff and quality of hotel, this made for a very good value. We were extremely happy with our stay at the Ames.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel for the Solo Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Iriske1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ames for a 4 nights vacation this May. It was my first time in Boston, and I chose the hotel based on the reviews and the location - it's super central, near the Subway station, the old state house and Quincy Market. I chose well! The room is very comfortable. There's enough room for your luggage, the bed is great and the bathroom is spacious and comfortable. The shower was amazing. My room was far from the elevator and it was very quiet. When I arrived at the hotel I found out my suitcase's wheel broke. The Bell-boy called the maintenance guy who immediately arrived and fixed it for me! The ladies at the front desk were very nice and friendly and gave me some tips about Boston, so I had everything I needed to explore Boston easily. You have quite a few coffee shops and restaurants around and the great Washington street where you can shop till you drop is very close. You can walk to the North End, Back Bay and Downtown easily, Boston is very walkable and easy to navigate around. Overall, I had a great stay. My room was great and comforting after a long day of touring the city, and its location is the best you can ask for.

Reviews.Title: “WORST experience ever”
Reviews.Author: CritiqueV
Reviews.Content: DO NOT ONLY RELY ON THE POSITIVE REVIEWS. I had to stay 3 nights in Boston for a certification training, and picked Ames based on the review here, on Tripadvisor. It ended up being the worst experience in my life. I stayed in a deluxe room 1) NO PRIVACY OR QUIETNESS. You hear EVERYTHING from the other rooms. Unbelievable. I could hear people talk, hear the TV like it was in my room...so if you're thinking about staying here for a romantic gateway, or to relax in a quiet room, just forget it. The noise was so bad it would wake me up when guests in the next room came back in the early hours... 2) WHERE IS THE LOBBY. And the warm welcome? When I was dropped in front of the hotel and came into the hotel, I thought is this a joke. It felt like I was going clubbing....the lobby is definitely not a lobby. There are two tiny little elevators (you don't fit more than 2 here) and it takes forever to go to the higher levels. On this comment, maybe it's me not liking the boutique hotel concept stretched to a maximum 3) E-UPGRADES=RIP-OFFS. The e-upgrades you will receive by email seem a bit desperate, like they want to make money so bad. Unfortunately, it worked for me. I selected a room on a higher floor, because I wanted to have a nicer view. The windows were just so small, felt like prison (see the picture) 4) ROOMS NOT WELL MAINTAINED. The decor is very nice, I very much like the concept, however, don't expect "quality". In my room, the light in the bathroom was making this annoying sound, it feels like whoever painted the walls was drunk, and the tv remote control worked 1 time out of 10... I've stayed in many hotels, for business and leisure, and I have to say this is my worst experience...Basically got no sleep because of the noise from the next rooms

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel, smack in the middle of Freedom Trail. Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: nikiraba5
Reviews.Content: Visited Boston this weekend w/ my husband. We thought the hotel was great. Beautiful building, excellent rooms, super location. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence At The Ames”
Reviews.Author: Sliphorn
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Ames Hotel in Boston. It is a new boutique hotel and has very modern amenities. The room was very white and allowed restful sleeping. It had many neat things like stand lights in stick form with rheostats. It was easy to get to from the freeway, a positive in this city. I had to play $10 for internet (never a good thing) but the connection was fast. The only thing I had noticed, after reading a previous trip advisor review, is that there is no sign on the building indicating that it is the Ames Hotel. There is a small sign saying it is the Ames Building. I also had made sure to look at the pictures of it so as to recognize the building. I had to go in and ask for valet parking and luggage unloading, but it was swift, friendly, and efficient. The location is right on the Freedom Trail so seeing the sights is easy. The staff are all friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Gem-like European Hotel in Bean Town”
Reviews.Author: LindCla5
Reviews.Content: Beautifully designed, modern, boutique-style hotel located in the historic Ames Building downtown Boston. Centrally located, near transportation and Faneuil Hall. Friendly and helpful staff, doormen, and concierge. Hip restaurant & bar on ground floor called the Woodward is THE place to go and be seen. Food is innovative and pricey. The rooms have high ceilings and hardwood floors. You must pay more for a "spacious" room and I suggest requesting a corner room if possible on the highest floor available. What they don't tell you? You will have "interesting" characters hanging out at all hours of the day and night because right next door to the hotel is a homeless shelter for veterans.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite get away”
Reviews.Author: jfhbryon
Reviews.Content: I in love with this hotel. The rooms are comfortable and stylish, I want to move in. The beds are amazing. Service is warm, friendly and professional. The Woodward restaurant and room service are both the tops. I have spend two long weekends there in the past six months and will be staying again. My only slight negative is that there are only two small elevators that can be difficult to get up and down with luggage. This is the one of the best boutiques I have ever stayed in. I love the hotel and staff, both are something special.

Reviews.Title: “Too cool to worry about the simple things”
Reviews.Author: TomSkelly
Reviews.Content: This hotel works very hard to let you know how Cool it is. It's so Cool, it doesn't have its name on the front of the building (a Morgan trademark, apparently). If peppermint-flavoured shampoo is important to you, this is your kind of place. On the other hand, if your definition of Cool includes help carrying your bags to your room, a sofa on which two normal-sized people can sit, minimal street noise, and a seat in the bar, you might find one of Boston's other hotels, in a less seedy part of town, a Cooler choice.

Reviews.Title: “A great, and lucky, discovery”
Reviews.Author: mwhitak
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. Have stayed in the sister hotel in New York (Morgan's) a couple of times and definitely rate Ames higher. I travel to Boston a couple of times a year from the UK on business and my assistant generally books everything for me. Previously she's booked me into the Ritz Carlton and the Mandarin Oriental, but in future I think I'll be asking to return here. Very smart, modern interiors, high ceilings, and possibly the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. Room service was excellent, staff were helpful, friendly and unobtrusive - generally ticked all my boxes. Will definitely - in fact, have already - recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Bluedisc36
Reviews.Content: Centrally located to numerous bars, restaurants, and shopping. For go the rental car and use the commuter rail(9.00 a day) or taxi, its' cheaper and less of a headache. The rooms are small, but nicely styled. Room can be noisy if facing the street. Workout room is small but adequate. I experienced a problem with my keys not working for a day. Mary at the front desk provided great customer service and helped remedy the problem. All the doorman provided helpful directions and sightseeing tips. It's a pleasure staying at a hotel where the staff actually enjoy their job and are friendly. Walking distance to the North End. Try Modern Pastry or Mike's Pastry for desert.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Fidoman47
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were able to stay here recently for our 3 year anniversary. I emailed ahead asking for some recommendations for dinner and the concierge got us awesome reservations at the top rated (trip advisor) seafood restaurant. Nina, you rock!! Thank you for your help too!! My wife loved the room and the view. Only problem we had which was quickly resolved was a $200.00 charge for smoking in our room. But I think it was a room next to us and the charge was quickly reversed. This hotel is central to all you want to see and do in Boston. Cross the street to the T and awesome food within walking distance. A great experience with awesome staff. Look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Why would you stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Deborah
Reviews.Content: My excellent stay at this hotel began before check in. It began when booking from Australia for two rooms. The website only allows you to book one room at a time (and I wanted two rooms at the special weekend rate) so I emailed the hotel I had a lovely email from one of the reservation staff (I will note share her name to save her being inundated with requests) She not only gave me two king sized rooms, when we checked in she had left a handwritten letter for me and for my nephew and his wife travelling with me. Rooms are modern with clean lines, something I love. Wooden floors and a lovely modern shower. One of the king rooms had a heated towel rail which proved popular with my fellow travellers. Beds were super comfy, great pillows. The concierge, Charles, was so helpful I felt we must have met before. I have travelled a bit and spoken to many concierge and they can be helpful but aloof. Charles was equally helpful but was friendly into the bargain. The next day he took the time to find out if the restaurant he recommended lived up to expectations (they did) All the staff were wonderful - checkin was friendly and efficient, bar staff, and the lovely young man who looked after our luggage after checkout and then braved the biting cold (and it was bitterly cold that weekend) to get us a cab. I had looked at a lot of hotels before choosing Ames - and now I would recommend it to anyone who asked. Why stay anywhere else? However, just onerequest - those floor boards can be cold when you first get out of bed (and as I said that weekend was freezing) so slippers would be appreciated to go with the lovely bath robes.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid for work.”
Reviews.Author: newalgier
Reviews.Content: Room was beautiful. Doorman was great. Restaurant service was dead slow--had a few meals (including breakfast) here and always had to hurry the servers along. Wifi is extra charge and didn't allow VPN passthrough, so I had to get up at 6 am to find a Starbucks to do my work. (Their VPN tech jockeys blamed my company, but it worked fine at the Starbucks). Ran out of hot water for the shower on my last day. Front desk person unbothered when I explained (politely) why I wouldn't be staying again. Great place if time is not an issue and the rooms are beautiful for a romantic getaway. Avoid if you need to work.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: VTang01
Reviews.Content: I just want to say WOW!!! I'm from small town USA and to drive into Boston is overwhelming. When we got there we were treated to a warm welcome to Boston and the Ames hotel. The valet/doormen were wonderfully nice! We arrived 3 hours before check-in and were upgraded to a King suite on the 5th floor at no extra charge!! Both front desk and doormen where very good at advising where to go and how to get there and after we would get back and they were always interested in how it was. The room was awesome, clean, comfortable. Shower was amazing also see through into the bed area which was different but exciting at the same time. We were told that we could check out and have our car stay in the garage until 2 and if we kept it there until 5 it would be another $16 compared to going to another garage and paying another $40.. Thank you Ames more all your help and hospitality you will see us again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bkny112
Reviews.Content: All the good reviews of the Ames that I read on TripAdvisor were accurate. I thoroughly enjoyed the weekend there - very comfortable. The staff - including Nina Sweet, the manager, who was very responsive - were all extremely friendly and helpful. A really great place to stay in Boston - I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best. Hotel. Ever”
Reviews.Author: HowellyBear
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. To say this has been the best hotel experience is an understatement. The whole hotel is just fabulous. Everything is so modern, minimalistic and stylish, starting with the lobby. A beautiful ceiling display greets you before you enter the lobby. The staff are incredibly friendly and attentive. But the best part is the room. A dark grey feature wall, pale wooden floorboards, and what must be the worlds most comfortable bed. Seriously, we just didn't want to leave! The room was heated to just the right temp - bliss. Now the bathroom... A huge shower with a huge round showerhead - with actual water pressure! And the Malin + Goetz bathroom toiletries were a wonderful touch. The only two small quibbles we had was that Internet was $10 a day - free wifi would have been awesome. Also, the credit card pre-autherisation was a bummer. $150 per day which we weren't advised about. The steepest thus far. We can't wait to come back to Boston and will be returning very gladly to the Ames. Do yourself a favour and stay here - it's the best!

Reviews.Title: “We were sold a suite with a separate room & didn't get one...”
Reviews.Author: LolaLeeLou
Reviews.Content: We were with our young son for Spring Break & had a very specific requirement for the hotel- we wanted a suite with a separate room that had a door that physically closed. We called back twice to reconfirm this was the case and arrived to find it was not. The front desk person stated: "Central reservations is not on site and they sometimes give out incorrect information" The hotel is trendy with a tiny fitness center & has failed to stay competitive with other hotels in its class. They do have great products in the bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in, and I travel a lot”
Reviews.Author: Nipperpenrose
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my 21-year-old daughter at the Ames in late March after getting a bargain rate on ebookers. The decor was modern and attractive, and the bathroom with huge walk-in shower was a dream. It was wonderfully clean, with big soft pillows and a nice firm bed. My daughter loved the large flatscreen TV. It was easy to access wifi (though I think it should be free in a hotel of this standard) and although valet parking was expensive at $42, it was convenient and the valets uber-helpful. I travel a lot in my work and found the Ames to be one of the best hotels in terms of service, decor and cleanliness that I've ever stayed in. We loved it. If only they'd put coffee makers in each room, I'd be in heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Well done.”
Reviews.Author: amirrf
Reviews.Content: Everything was easy, stylish and pleasant at the Ames. Check in was a breeze; staff was friendly throughout. My 15th floor room was modern but comfortable. The King Size bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was spacious; walk-in shower was fantastic. Everything worked, though there was a faint, annoying rattling sound that came from i side the wall or outside the hotel (I stayed in Room 1501). That said, would definitely stay here again. The Ames hits all the right notes without looking like it's trying too hard. Modern where appropriate but understated as well. The hotel restaurant/bar served a great dinner and the scene at the bar was lively (largely young professionals).

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional stay at Ames”
Reviews.Author: nasdaqnole
Reviews.Content: Ames is a wonderful boutique type of Hotel located a stones throw from Boston Common and Quincy Market. Our experience has been so enjoyable that I am writing this on the 3rd day of our 5 day stay (from the room). The staff at Ames are the most customer service oriented group of folks I've ever experienced while traveling. Nina Sweet (front office manager) and Charles Currier (concierge) played a major role in making our stay remarkale. In the week prior to our arriving in Boston, I emailed Nina to introduce myself and mention to her how much we were looking forward to our stay.. She responded the following day and stated that she had upgraded our room from the standard queen we had booked to a Deluxe King. Additionally, she has provided us with complimentary internet use during our stay, which is allowing me to write this review at no cost.. The pictures posted of the hotel are accurate in that the hotel is very hip and asthetically pleasing to the eyes. Additionally, the room is very comfortable with wood and marble flooring,12 foot ceilings and a window that likely measures 10ft by 6 ft, a 40in flat panel television, very comfortable bed, refridgerator, a safe large enough to store a laptop, complimentary toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soap, and body wash) and bath robes. We've been to Boston 2 times prior to this saty, and Ames has been a major factor in making this our best trip yet. Thank you Nina, Charles, and staff!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdngirl83
Reviews.Content: The perfect mix of modern and character. This beautiful old building has been restored and is a modern clean and stunning space. The rooms are small but comfortable. Beds are comfortable and nice TV, minibar etc etc. Its lovely. The showers were incredible. Best showers I've ever had at a hotel, felt like was at the spa with the rain shower head and huge deep tub. Location was perfect as well. Right next to subway station and walking distance from everything Boston has to offer. Overall a perfect experience - would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AgentStoffel
Reviews.Content: My GF and I stayed here February 14th to the 21st 2011. We arrived at 6am on the 14th and we were greeted by a wonderful front desk and doorman. We were pleasantly surprised to have our room ready at 6am since we were exhausted from the red eye. The room was very modern and cool, great mini bar with extras! The bathroom is amazingly large with a great shower. The room had a sweet view of the city! We ate at the restaurant a few times and had room service both very good. The staff was very attentive and actually the manager sent up a bottle of Champagne when she found out we had just got engaged on our trip. The gym was nice, bed comfy, yes as others said the toilet sometimes needed to be flushed twice lol not a biggie, and the closet was on the small side but it all worked out! The most important feature of the hotel is the location. The Location is a great reason to come back to this hotel. I will stay here for sure on my next trip to Boston....They have a customer for life.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will recommend!”
Reviews.Author: liesel300
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel. Wish we could have stayed longer. Charles, the concierge, and the person who checked us in were more than helpful. The location was perfect. Easily walkable to many bars, restaurants, etc. I would recommend this for couples. It was great experience and look forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: PaulKubby
Reviews.Content: Writing this review way past our stay but just wanted to say thanks to the Ames for a great night and delicious breakfast. Stop at the Ames on the way to a weekend in Vermont for my girlfriends b-day. Had a corner suite which we hope to live in someday! Staff was great and the breakfast was delivered fast, hot and delicious. Thanks for starting our weekend off so beautifully.

Reviews.Title: “I've been to Boston over twenty times and just discovered the best!”
Reviews.Author: nkspas
Reviews.Content: Yes, yes, yes! I saw Nina Sweet from Ames commenting on this website so I emailed her and she took care of everything! Check in was quick and painless, the room was beauitful (they upgraded us to a corner suite, va va voom!), and when we got there someone knocked on the door and said... "A complimentary bottle of wine!" I'm 31 and my girlfriend is 25 and this was absolutely perfect for us. The hotel was a certain cool vibe that is hard to explain -- is it the music and giant convex mirror in the elevator, the sharpened pencil lying perfectly on your room desk, or the orange sweaters the doormen wear? I don't know and I don't care. All I know is top notch service with a smile + an amazing room with a beautiful view in the best part of town (5 minute walk to the pier and Legal Seafoods and and right across the street from a subway stop) = Excellent! If I was forced to register one area of improvement I'd probably say the gym. It's an older building so they did what they could and certainly have a lot of modern cardio + free weights + machines. But it's crammed like a sardine can in there. Leave your leg lunges at home. Overall, I rate this hotel great, great, great and plan to stay there over a weekend again in a couple months. We honestly didn't want to leave! Neil p.s. I ordered fresh tulips from the concierge for our stay -- they cost extra but I highly recommend this for an added touch all weekend. Great quality... and I think it may be why we got the bottle of wine thrown in on top of the upgrade!

Reviews.Title: “This is the only place I ever want to stay in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: BuddyEleanor
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip to Boston for my husband's Christmas present and selected the Ames Hotel based on many of the reviews I read here and pictures I saw. Because I booked so early, I also got a special rate which was significantly less than the posted rates. So, I was happy. But then we got there on Friday (2/18) and were upgraded to the 12th floor suite- holy-mother-of-awesome! Like the public areas of the hotel, the suite was a sleek deep gray and white, with windows about knee height up to the top of the 10 foot ceilings. Lightweight white drapes from ceiling to floor filtered the light beautifully and combined with the light hardwood floor gave warmth to what could have been cold modernity. The bedroom and bathroom were equally sleek and kind of sexy and contained toiletries you actually want to use- they smelled fantastic! The shower- oh that shower- large enough for two with glass and white marble walls and a rain shower head and handheld was a vacation in itself. Linens were all crisp and white- something we truly appreciated considering our two big black dogs at home (crisp and white don't exist in our world), but I digress. You might wonder why we only gave sleep quality a 4 out of 5- the mattress was a bit firm for us. But that doesn't mean we didn't sleep. ;-) Housekeeping was very good- so clean you could have eaten from the floor, though I don't recommend it. On to the service- you can not imagine how helpful the Ames staff was. Given it's location and decor, it would have been entirely possible for them to be tragically hip and too cool for school. While dressed that way (cute uniforms- esp. for the desk staff), they were all incredibly warm and friendly, most notably Charles, the concierge. Charles, while not only infinitely knowledgeable about the city, was quite charming as well. Being laid back and low-key, we were looking for places to eat that matched that description. Both places he sent us fit the bill perfectly- especially Mother Anna's. The food was delicious and the place homey. Charles also gave us menu recommendations based on some of his favorites at each place- and had that glorious eggplant rollatini waiting when we arrived. I could go on about Charles and his infinite awesomeness, but I'm sure you get the picture. As far as food goes, the Woodward was delicious- we had drinks and dinner there and brunch as well. They mix a great bloody mary and the 1692 Brew is not to be missed. The complete menu was also available for room service which we ordered our second morning there and when we had the sourdough blueberry pancakes- to die for! Lastly- the location could not have been better. A very short walk in one direction gets you to the blue and orange lines and to the red and green in another. We were also right on the Freedom Trail, a short walk to Boston Commons, the State House and a multitude of other sites. Overall, this was a great place to stay. We actually spent a fair amount of time in our room because it was so cold outside, and that was as enjoyable as anything else we did. We'll definitely be returning to the Ames.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Saltman56
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ames Morgan Hotel in Boston for five nights in January 2011. The hotel is in excellent condition. The rooms are new, fresh and tastefully decorated. My room was not huge but more than adequate. The location was fabulous. I was able to walk almost everywhere I wanted to go even though my stay was during the biggest storm to date this winter. The same storm that shut down much of the country. Not that you want to leave the Ames as the food is excellent, service impeccable, the scene at the bar a blast. I have stayed at many hotels in Boston over the years. My prior three visits I stayed at the Inter-Continental. While the facilities at the IC are equivalent or maybe better due to it being a larger hotel what puts the Ames way ahead in my book is the staff. Every staff person I interacted with during my five days there was top notch. I found the staff to be very helpful, attentive, but not overbearing. Nina Sweet the Assistant Front Desk Manager is a Superstar. When I had to extend my stay due to the weather she went out of her way to accomodate me. That was the only issue I had during my stay at the Ames, the weather. Even Nina could not fix the weather, but she sure made being stuck in Boston during this cold winter a positive experience . My thanks everyone at the Ames.

Reviews.Title: “This was a fantastic hotel - great rooms and great service”
Reviews.Author: loves2travel91776
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the rooms and service at this hotel. Normally i stay at the W in Boston but decided to try something different and i was very impressed. the rooms were very clean and swanky. the bathrooms and rooms were very well appointed. the front desk and restaurant service were excellent. i would highly recommend this hotel to someone who likes the Philip Starck feel but more comfortable than what is typically found in his designed hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Aems was a great value and a great stay”
Reviews.Author: kleib5018
Reviews.Content: I was attending Training in Boston and stayed at the Aems in Feb. I thought the hotel was wonderful and a great value. The staff was amazing, the rooms extremely clean and everything was within walking distance. I never once had to get a cab. I really thought it was a great value and if I ever get to Boston again I will def stay at the Ames.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel as close to perfect as you can get; so much better than the big chains.”
Reviews.Author: Alchemist333
Reviews.Content: So, I was looking for a unique hotel experience in Boston and came across the Ames, a boutique hotel recently renovated. I love history and this building was the former headquarters of the Ames Plow Company and at one time was the tallest building in Boston. The rooms have an exceptional layout and you can tell they used wonderful bedding materials that are exceptionally comfortable. In addition there is a fabulous restaurant, the Woodward which had a great weekend night scene and great food. Of the dozens of hotels I've stayed at around the world this surpasses all of the big chains and is in the top 1% of places I've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Pretzellogix
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend on a recent trip to Boston to celebrate a birthday. We stay in Boston relatively often, and had wanted to check out the Ames for some time now, but because we usually travel with our dogs, we typically stay at the Mandarin or at the Marlowe in Cambridge. This time we got a pet sitter, and were able to stay at the Ames. Pros: The location is excellent, with many good restaurants in the area, and Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market, as well as Long Wharf, all within a few minute walk. The building is historic, and the design inside the hotel is great. Not sure how all the white will hold up over time, and can certainly understand why the hotel is not pet friendly, but for the time being, the rooms look awesome. The glass wall showers are a great touch for couples, but could be awkward for others. Without exception, every single staff member we interacted with were extremely nice and pleasant. From the bellhop, front desk, room service, to all the restaurant staff, everyone was so nice! All the food was really good as well. We had dinner at Woodward on the first night, and everything was very, very good. Service was prompt and attentive, and we had a wonderful time. We also ordered breakfast from room service one morning, and it also was fantastic. Props to the kitchen! Overall, this hotel is a good value, at least compared to some other places in Boston. Style-wise, this place is really hip, with cool people, cool design, and a cool vibe overall. Cons: Only a few rooms have tubs. Sometimes it is nice to soak in a big hotel tub, but in this case, at least the showers were huge and... entertaining. There is some noise. It didn't bother us, but you could definitely hear emergency vehicles and the subway from time to time. Not a big deal, but if you are not used to city noise, or are like the tomb like feeling at the Four Seasons, Mandarin, or Ritz, this may not be for you. No spa. It would be great if there were even a small spa with steam room, sauna, and massage services. I think appointments can be booked in room, but it is just not the same. Overall, we loved the Ames, and will likely stay there again next time we go to Boston without our dogs.

Reviews.Title: “One of my Worst”
Reviews.Author: Tk08
Reviews.Content: Everything was ok. Nothing stood out. The rooms were stark and empty, which may be a modern look, but seemed cheap. It was also odd that our "deluxe room" was rather small. The bathroom was visible from the bed with the glass panels and even with the curtain there was no privacy. The problems really began at checkout. I was charged for multiple nights of parking, when I only stayed for one that included parking. I was charged for items that were previously taken from the mini bar (I did not realize I was supposed to check the mini bar for the hotel when I arrived - they actually said that to me). And then the topper was when the valet would not return my car key, until he received a tip. Even though I had given him $10 on the way in. Needless to say, I will not be staying at the Ames again.

Reviews.Title: “don't get deceived by the decent price”
Reviews.Author: marijamr
Reviews.Content: They attract you with a decent price, but as soon as you arrive you realize you've been deceived. There's no parking space around the hotel, and you must accept their valet parking - they say it's $42 per day, but I was charged $48. At our arrival the receptionist told us that we've been upgraded from a queen to a superior king, but we still ended up with a regular queen. Wi-fi internet is an additional $10 per day, and the speed is almost equal to dial-up. When we checked out (an hour earlier) they said that we can go sightseeing and leave the luggage and the car for no additional charge. However, my account was charged another $16, plus $ 48, plus 18 $. When I called for an explanation they said the $18 was a mistake and the rest is for late departure, which was supposedly counted after 2pm, and we took our things 2:15. Overall it turned out to be more expensive than Boston Harbor Hotel or other exclusive place.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra modern boutique hotel in a historic setting”
Reviews.Author: FLBeachAddict
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night from a Hotwire rate of $119 plus tax. For downtown Boston, and the level of this Morgan hotel, we found the value to be excellent. Of course, we were there two days before a noreaster. The building was origionally built as office space and was once the tallest building in downtown Boston. When we pulled up, the bell staff were very friendly and helpful. The staff at the front desk were extremely polite, friendly and efficient. The room was ultra modern with a lot of special touches. The bathroom was designed to be energy efficient and has towel heaters, shower has a wand and a strong, hot shower head. The Malin and Goetz body products were amazing. The mini bar had special extras to cover anything forgotten including full bottles of liquor, workout clothes, and personal pleasure kits. The bar is very chic with an amazing special drink menu. The decor is full of interesting vignettes to browse. Upstaris, the restaurant has an amazing view of downtown Boston. Would most definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Haywsj9
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful night... However my boyfriend and I are both young (24) and it might not be as fun for families. The view was amazing and the service was great. The hotel is in the perfect place- walking distance Faneuil hall and a bunch of great restaurants (less than five minute walk). The only bad thing was that it was a little hard to find! I wish we could have stayed longer but we will definitely be going back for another special

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary design, lively atmosphere, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: IanBTotteridge
Reviews.Content: The Ames is situated 15 mins from the airport and a couple of mins walk from the bustling Quincy Hall, market area. You would do well to recognise the hotel when you first pull up, but once inside you immediately know you are in a Morgans hotel, the sparse design lead furniture, long table in the bar and great lighting. Our room, was large, airy and very comfortable, a great stocked mini bar and amazing shower. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, particularly in the restaurant/bar, Woodward where they really took the time to make you feel welcome. We would highly recommend a stay at The Ames when you are next in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel in a great city with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: grimb0
Reviews.Content: The Ames is perfectly placed to discover Boston, within five minutes walk of the Common, the Harbour, Downtown Crossing and many of the main historical sites. The rooms are great, the beds amazingly comfortable and the shower as good as any I have used. The staff are friendly and helpful and Nina worked some magic to make our stay extra special. Next time we come to Boston we know where we will want to stay. If I was going to be ultra picky, I would suggest tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms as the one addition to the available services that would be appreciated by many visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: RangersFan10
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great city! Our room was unique and was the entire hotel-including the dining areas. We really enjoyed the eclectic collection of accents and furnishings. The staff was over-the-top! We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and an amazing staff, but I had a few minor quibbles...”
Reviews.Author: M_Harley
Reviews.Content: I was booked by my client a the Ames just last week (Dec 16-18). Upon arrival, everyone on the staff (from valet to front desk) greeted me with a big smile and seemed to go out of their way to ensure my stay was pleasant â€” there was an issue with my key, so they personally walked me up to my room and made sure I wasn't inconvenienced! The hotel is is a near-perfect location downtown â€” a short walk will find you nearly any type of food, or activity. My room was a standard double on the eleventh floor, direcly across from the elevator (one of the smallest rooms). The decor and amenities were nice, and it was very comfortable. Lots of power outlets by the desk, and plenty of hot water pouring from the shower head (and a deep tub). However, I had two small issues during my stay: First, the hotel's wireless Internet access was acting up in my room and I had to constantly log in to their router (with a passcode). I used several wireless devices, and I had the problem with all three. Second, my room's location meant other loud guests would exit the elevator and the noise would be channeled directly into my room. I was awaken several times by unruly guests during the night (holiday parties going on downstairs). Overal, I do recommend the hotel as I feel both my quibbles were room-specific. A hotel's staff often makes-or-breaks a stay â€” and the employees at the Ames were giving everything one-hundred percent (with a smile). I'd go back without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: LynneM77
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Ames twice this year - once in June and once just this past weekend. Both times have been great experiences. We stumbled across the Ames when we won a bid on Priceline back in June. We needed to be in Boston due to a death in the family and didn't want to pay a lot of $. I can't remember exactly what the price was of the winning bid, but all I do remember is thinking to myself - "Boy, we really hit the jackpot!" as soon as we walked into the hotel... because the quality of the hotel clearly exceeded the price I had paid....and my expectations. First of all, the exterior of the building is beautiful... I love all of the arches. Secondly, the location is truly superb. It's just a five minute walk to many places such as Faneuil Hall and the North End. The Old State House and the Freedom Trail are located directly outside the hotel. There are two T stations within a minutes walk! What more could you ask for? Wait - there is more - the interior is beautiful... modern and funky.... but comfortable at the same time. The staff is very attentive... there to open the door, valet your car, answer questions about the area, etc. Excellent service! The beds are very comfortable. The first time we stayed at Ames we had two queen beds - they were very comfortable. This time around we were able to get a king and that was also very comfortable. There is also a very nice modern tavern called Woodwards. I love their "Polished Passion" drink. It's a great place to start your night off. It's also a great place for breakfast. I ordered the duck confit and carmalized onion hash this past weekend and it was unbelievable. I wish I took an order to go with me so I could have some now! Next time I stay I will definitely try them out for dinner.... or better yet - dessert - I saw some really great looking creations coming out of the kitchen when I was there for drinks Friday night. From now on Ames will be the first place I check for availability when I travel up to Boston and it's the only hotel I will recommend to my family and friends in the Boston area. No more priceline for me - I don't want to risk getting stuck in a different hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Form Over Function”
Reviews.Author: FreddieMertz
Reviews.Content: Although the decor of this hotel was marvelously funky and modern, I was somewhat disappointed with some physical aspects of the room. For starters, the mattress was "pull-out" quality -- think and lumpy with little support. I also had trouble controlling the temperature of the room -- the thermostat was needlessly complicated. Finally, the shower stall had no sliding door or other way to enclose the space -- not unusual for a trendy hotel, but it still makes it difficult to get the shower area nice and steamy/warm. Have a curtain that exposes the bathroom to the rest of the room is cool and interesting, but I'll take a comfortable bed and shower ahead of funky decor any day.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: La82k2
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife just got back from 5 nights in Boston, the hotel was absolutely amazing. We had the most amazing room, fantastic views over the financial district and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. I would love to know where to get that bed from to have at home. Wow. The showers are brilliant, the design of the rooms are fantastic, and the furniture was very funky. The only small issue we had was the heating being a little loud when it came on, but that's just being a bit picky. The value of the hotel was outstanding. I had been to Boston twice before and stayed at 15 beacon which is also a lovely hotel but this time round the price of 15 beacon was so much more than Ames I thought I would give it a chance, which I'm glad we did. Can't wait to visit again soon

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, contemporary hotel with relaxed, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Gare_du_Nord
Reviews.Content: We had an outstanding 3 nights at Ames. The rooms are modern, beautifully appointed and a good size. The staff were outstanding, with a relaxed, welcoming attitude. We would definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, location and a beautifully restored and updated building.”
Reviews.Author: JaneReigate_Surreyuk
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Ames was fantastic. All the staff, but particularly Nina and Charles, couldn't have been more helpful in advance of and during our stay. Ames is extremely stylish with a cool vibe. The bar is lively and the restaurant serves excellent food. The Ames is just a few feet away from the freedom trail, we walked every where from the hotel. If you go to Boston try and stay at Ames.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: islandatelier
Reviews.Content: I love staying in boutique hotels and the Ames did not disappoint. The hotel is not large hotel by most standards, but it is beautifully furnished and the staff were quite attentive. I booked the day before I was due to travel and was lucky enough to get the corner room on my floor which afforded me views in two directions and overlooked the Old State House. The only drawback I can determine was that the hotel does not offer many extra facilities like a spa or pool; it is more of a business venue and is located solidly in the financial district (which made it a bit of a stroll to the main shopping streets). However for my needs being a short-term stay in the city, it proved more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent beantown experience”
Reviews.Author: filzzz
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, solved all my problems (, early check in, late check out, room change due to unruly neighbors, finding cab in pouring rain, etc). Minimal deco is welcome, while views of financial district and even airport make rooms highly livable. Only glitch: inadequate sound proofing (noisy revelers next door woke us up at 3 am), although the staff took care of it by getting them to quiet down and by moving us to better room on top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: hoteladdiction
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ames Hotel for a one night getaway and we loved it. The hotel is within walking distance to zillions of restaurants, bars, shops, etc. We enjoyed being able to walk around and see so much so right outside the hotel door. When we arrived we had drinks in the bar (Woodward's) and we were blown away by the drinks we had. They have some of the coolest libation concoctions I've seen yet. We had a fresh squeezed cranberry margarita (they actually press the berries right in front of you) with a slice of jalapeno as a garnish that added a fabulous kick. Very creative! The room was perfect and spotlessly clean. The shower was the best part of the room by far. It was a little noisy from the street below but that's what you get when you want to stay in a downtown locale. All in all, we loved the hotel and will be back on our next trip. As a side note, there is absolutely no signage on the hotel so it's not easy to find but once you do, you'll be impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: BrianJohnson24
Reviews.Content: Booked the Ames sight unseen and had an outstanding experience. Immaculate room, attentive service from every employee we encountered, and a location perfect for getting around Boston. Special thanks to Charles the Concierge who noted the special occasion we were visiting for and providing the extra attention that makes your vacation a very memorable one. I would highly recommend the Ames

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in the center of everything”
Reviews.Author: MattSF76
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the AMES. It is definately a chic hotel with wood floors and an amazing bathroom with a glass shower that looks into the bedroom. (Not very private so be sure you are close to whomever you will be sharing the room with and you shouldn't have a problem.) The service at this hotel is top notch. From the door men, to the front desk, to the restaurant staff, they were all friendly helpful and had a smile on their faces. Special thanks to Nina Sweet for making our special occasion that much more special. Had breakfast at the Woodward which was SOOOO good. Lobster Hash is a must try!!!! The drink prices are a little high, but not unexpected from a Morgan Hotel. Location of this hotel could not be better. Central to the MBTA subway with two stations just yards away. You are right on the Freedom Trail and just a block from the shopping and restaurants of Quincy Market. You can also easily walk to the aquarium, Beacon Hill and Boston Commons. Next time we stay in Boston, you will see us at the AMES!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DiniSimsbury
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night in Boston to attend a concert. The staff was very welcoming and friendly, our room was sparkling clean and had the most funky, modern decor. It's walking distance to wonderful pubs, shopping and the Orpheum Theater. Our only "problem" was finding the hotel - in order to preserve historical features of the Ames Building, no where does it say "hotel." But once we were inside, we felt right at home! We loved it and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool,modern hotel in an awesome historical location!”
Reviews.Author: kddorn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple days, loved everything! The rooms are excellently styled and modern, contrasting the old historical building and neighborhood around it. Restaurant is cool and incredibly good. The staff is very friendly. Amazing time in a great location in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Never wanted to leave...”
Reviews.Author: cindlrella
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this amazing hotel! It was beautiful, great location, modern, and the bed was so incredibly comfortable. From the minute that we walked in, the staff was accommodating and you honestly felt like royalty. Highly recommend to families or young travelers. The hotel is close to the harbor, all the bars/restaurants, and shopping. There are glass walls, king size beds, flat screen tvs... Cannot say enough about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs at Ames”
Reviews.Author: felixnavidad2
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we discovered a bug next to our bed. The managers response was alarming: We were surprised to learn from her that in her opinion the bedbug problem was blown out of proportion by the media. We checked out immediately and will not return.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIFIC HIP HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: tobeginwith
Reviews.Content: The Ames is a hip (but not snotty) boutique hotel. Small, nicely appointed rooms, friendly staff and a great location. The hotel bar/cafe is quite good, too. My only complaint is that the pillows are all over-sized and I found them a bit uncomfortable - i prefer something smaller or a mix. But the bed was comfy. All in all, a nice place to rest your noggin.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service & Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: sac26
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at Ames we were greeted at the front desk by a wonderful guy (John) that asked us about our trip and really made an effort to make us feel welcome. I requested a room on a top floor after reading reviews about potential bar noise at night. My wish was granted and we received an upgraded king room on the 14th floor. The hotel is very modern - definitely not like any place that I usually stay. The king size room is a decent size for Boston where many rooms are small. The designers definitely went for a minimalist feel with clean lines. The shower is glass on all sides and looks into the bedroom / living area. There is a curtain for privacy but I would say that this type of room is not great for families - it definitely has a sexy feel. The bed was very comfy and both the side chair and desk chair were comfortable as well. The one piece of advice I would give women is to bring your own hair dryer. The hair dryer provided is not very good but honestly - that's it - the room and hotel were top notch. We stopped into the bar on our last night for a night cap and ended up staying for hours because it was so much fun. The bartenders are fantastic and the DJ was also very good. On our last day we ate brunch at the in house restaurant Woodward. Service was relatively slow for an empty restaurant but the staff was very friendly and nice to be around. All in all I will definitely consider staying in more Morgan Group hotels from now on. The attention to detail of the staff and willingness to help you are very much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at the Ames”
Reviews.Author: julieandjoe
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Boston - for business or pleasure, the Ames is the perfect location. We spent 3 nights and had a great trip. Rooms are modern an clean. Beds and pillows are comfortable. Flat screen TV with good selection of channels offered. Other than the fact that they charge extra for Wi-Fi, everything was just what we hoped for it to be. Free Wi-Fi is just steps away at one or the other of 2 Starbucks very near the front door of the Ames. Hotels in Boston are really expensive, especially if you choose your hotel for location. Right on the Freedom Trail puts you in the best position to make the most of your time.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel for the international business traveler”
Reviews.Author: MarkBeeching
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, it's a fun boutique hotel trying to be stylish and minimal. The quality of the floors and fitments doesn't quite make the grade. And this flavor of minimal now feels very tired and old fashioned. But that' is not the point of my review. The real problem is it doesn't work for business meetings or international travel. They failed to deliver on the basics - like the screen I was assured we would be able to present on. We couldn't. \or enough seating even. Plus, my colleagues were flying in from all sorts of time zones. But no room service at all till 6.30am!! And no breakfast till 7am. Not acceptable. The head of HR was a hero trying to make up for the shortfalls. But I could do without the mini vibrator available with the mini bar (I bring my own) and a little better attention to my other needs instead.

Reviews.Title: “So busy being cool they forget they are running a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Madronatree
Reviews.Content: I have never had such a miserable hotel stay. Travelling with my son on a college visit to Boston, we arrived at the Ames to find they had our reservation in one program but not another, so no room. They put us in a room with a king size bed instead of the two queen beds on our reservation, gave us a complimentary roll away (which they made sure to tell us they would normally charge for) and a shower with a glass wall looking out on the bedroom. Not a great set up for mother and son. Now 1 1/2 hours into the snafu check in process, they switched our room upon our complaint about the shower, and the young man who brought the key joked that they would pay for any therapy my son would need at the thought of his mother showering. And for this we were paying top dollar! The concierge recommended an awful Italian restaurnant in the north end that he must have been getting kickbacks from, Mother Anna's. As we walked the neighborhood after our yucky meal we found several other much better restaurants for half the price. I slept on an uncomfortable roll away instead of a comfy bed. For $411 a night. The room across the hall (the one they moved us out of) had new guests arrive who partied and ordered room service late into the night, waking me several times. They made our room up late the next day. I ordered a caesar from room service for a late dinner the second night and they brought up a grilled shrimp salad. We started joking that we had to find something this hotel did right. The wake up call was delivered on time both mornings! We had an early flight the morning we left Boston, but room service did not start until 6am, so no coffee before we left. I asked the front desk for change for a $20 so I could tip the bellman, but they didn't have any money. The worst hotel experience I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortable I've ever been at a hotel, and I can't stop staring at the room.”
Reviews.Author: Allayee
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The clean, minimalist style of the rooms is very aesthetically pleasing and cozy too. I love the decor in the bathroom. Service? Awesome. I'm here for work and they were so helpful with everything I needed. Would love to stay here again. Downstairs bar is hip and comfortable. I feel bad even saying this, but am I the only one who thought there was something funky about the shampoo? It made my hair very coarse and like there was still shampoo residue in there, no matter how long I spent rinsing. Other than that, perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in central position”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterSurrey
Reviews.Content: A new hotel in an historic building overlooking the Old State house. It is ideally situated for the Freedom Trail and Boston Common as well as the harbour. We found it very comfortable and moderately priced if you avoid the minibar.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: xsfritz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Ames in late August for business. The service was incredible and the room lived up to the hype--modern and brimming with style and sexiness. The shower was simply awesome. The location was great for me. I had breakfast downstairs at the Woodward twice (which looked to have a lively nightlife scene) and was thoroughly satisfied with both the crab and lobster hash.

Reviews.Title: “another great time at the Ames”
Reviews.Author: nuggets00
