Reviews.Content: This was our second time at the Ames and it was great. Our room was roomy and quiet and I love the interior design of both the rooms and the common areas. As is true with all Morgan's hotels that I've stayed at, the staff really makes the Ames. Friendly, courteous, charismatic, and helpful. The restaurant has great food and some of the very best bartenders I've experienced. We'll definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Brittam
Reviews.Content: This is a fun boutique hotel, excellent customer service and a great location. Check-in and check-out was quick and easy - everyone is really friendly and helpful. The staff was a young professional crowd. My room had a modern design with only a shower (no tub). A curtain separates the shower with the bedroom, I don't mind this but others might. The bed was extremely comfortable with great pillows. I slept really well! This is a pretty new hotel and everything in the room seemed really clean and new. This feeling was helped by the high ceilings, big white walls and hardwood floor. The room might be on the small side but it is perfect for solo / business travelers. I was sick while I was there and they ran out for medicine (I can't remember his name - Joe?) and were really flexible with everything - top marks for the management of this hotel. Room service - a little expensive in comparison to other hotels and they had no white or wheat bread - only rye, but the food was good. I will stay in this hotel again while in Boston as long as I can get a good rate. I've noticed the price fluctuates a lot.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EM4
Reviews.Content: We planned to stay at the Ames after a tour of New England celebrating our anniversary and would have to say Nina Sweet helped make it extra special, I emailed ahead as wanted a higher room due to some reviews about road noise, there is some but still slept well! Nina upgraded our room and there was a bottle of chilled wine waiting in our room! Lovely!! the room itself was gorgeous very funky, huge tv and super comfy bed and the bathroom huge,great shower too. Was surprised that a 4* hotel charges for internet usage after not being charged anywhere else but that was really the only niggle, the location is fantastic right behind quincy market and the staff were without exception very helpful, one of the guys on reception googled where was good for steak nearby - great service. Loved it here and the staff were really great but thank you Nina for making it extra special!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: AandASanJose_CA
Reviews.Content: We've stayed twice at the Ames and both times the hotel itself has been wonderful. The room (we had a suite) was one of the best I've stayed in on a corner of the hotel with great views over the Custom's House. Service is generally very good although one evening we went to the bar after dinner and after 15 minutes abandoned it when no one could be bothered to take our order. Having said that the 2 bars are excellent and the hotel is superbly located for sightseeing etc. Our only gripe is that it is incredibly noisy - on a Saturday night drunken revelers (presumably from the hotel's own bar) keep going until 2am, sirens abound throughout the night from various emergency vehicles and the local garbage collection starts up at around 4am, not to mention that there is construction nearby which has been going on for the last year which also starts incredibly early. I'm not sure if the windows aren't sufficiently sound proofed but having been kept awake all night for 3 out of our 5 nights it is bad enough not to return despite the overall excellence of the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “This place rocks!!!”
Reviews.Author: gslindy
Reviews.Content: I have traveled the world and have never been to a place that had better service from every aspect. I will always look for a Morgan's Hotel whenever traveling in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Modern, Clean & Comfy”
Reviews.Author: Oran27
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Boston before and staying at the Ames contributed to such a positive experience. The manager (Nina) was extremely generous with the upgraded room - which had amazing views and a very modern but comfortable style. The hotel's location was excellent - a couple steps away from everything. I wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: johnnyuk50
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days in Boston to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and found the Ames comfortable and very friendly. The staff were very helpful. The location is unbeatable - right on the Freedom trail, with lots of central locations within easy walking distance. I'd recommend that you ask for a room on an upper floor as the central location means that the streets below are pretty noisy and there were roadworks as well. But we were well away from it in our 11th floor room, which was modern, bright and well laid out. We had a really memorable stay - highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to take in the sights of Boston”
Reviews.Author: VixiO
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a fantastic location, perfect for seeing the sights x near to the harbour for whale watching, near to Boston Common for a walk in the park and near to several subway stations which can get you all around boston by tube. Staff were amazingly friendly and helpful and were more than willing to go the extra mile to make our stay perfect. We only ate in the hotel at breakfast, and there was an excellent choice available and the staff were very attentive. We have stayed in Morgan hotels before and like their hip, minimalistic style. The room was well equipped with a huge bed, TV and shower. More than enough room for a city break and very very comfortable!! This hotel is a bit expensive, but the quaility of the staff and accomodation shows you why you have spent the extra $. Concierge are more that happy to help you with bookings and arrange a lovely dinner for us at a local restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: scanetta
Reviews.Content: On a recent return trip to Boston, decided to try the Ames. Did not dissapoint. Rooms were very modern but quiet. Enjoyed the breakfast in the restaurant. Others complained about the noise but we were there on a weekend and we had no problem. Quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very unique. MinimilistIc styling. Great location”
Reviews.Author: friendNewYork
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay. The room is very unique in a fun way ! However, be warned that noise can be a downer! Jack hammering began at about midnight until morning. We were on the 11 th floor. It was definitely mind blowing. The staff was good and gave us ear plugs the next night. The service in the restaurant was poor. We waited about 20 minutes for breakfast. Not bad but there were only 6 people in the restaurant!! My husband had a headache from the Jack hammering and left before he could eat! Great location but beware of the pitfalls !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel stay-somewhat expensive...”
Reviews.Author: pacolsu
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel stay-somewhat expensive but definitely upscale. Nice bar and service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Ames!”
Reviews.Author: kpowell05
Reviews.Content: We worked with hotel manager Nina Sweet and she was wonderful! Our stay with you was fantastic! We loved Boston and the hotel; what a great location the Ames has. Thank you so much for all of your help and for the goodies that were delivered to our room for our birthday. Once we arrived we were upgraded to a wonderful corner room which we appreciated so much. Thank you again very much for such wonderful hospitality, we will be back soon and sending along the hotelâ€™s information to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: AW77
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel was upgraded on arrival to a lovely room location excellent for Boston Harbourside and Freedom Trail

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the Centre of Boston”
Reviews.Author: chipmanh
Reviews.Content: I had never heard of the Ames Hotel, nor the Morgan Hotels when I booked at Ames in Boston. It was a totally satisfactory experience in all regards. Staff were great, room was great, excellent bathroom, and several interesting touches that I had not seen before such as back to back TV's for living area and bedroom. Great ideas!! Staff were excellent. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good. predictable.”
Reviews.Author: mkindler
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the ames for 2 nights and got pretty much what we were looking for. if you have been to one shrager hotel you know them all ;-). rooms have a good size and are well equipped. nice bathrooms - if you like the "shower in the window" thing so many design hotels consider contemporary. unfortunately no free wifi but there is a starbucks just around the corner. the bar is hip so very crowded at night. the location is absolutely perfect, right there on freedom trail. we liked it.

Reviews.Title: “It is original”
Reviews.Author: copan28
Reviews.Content: Unlike most reviewers, I am not sure if the location is the best thing about the Ames Hotel. It is located in a tight area with heavy people\vehicle traffic and it is right beside a homeless center [not shelter, I think] where you see homeless people coming in and out or hanging around. It is walking distance to most points of interests and close to 2 T-stations but so are many hotels in the various Boston districts. There are not many restaurants nearby but there are many fast food places. It is not an ideal hotel for families but convenient for young singles or couples. The dÃ©cor is modern and the rooms have a minimalist look. It does have a distinct style that is very appealing. The wooden floors really does adds to the roomâ€™s appeal. The bed was excellent and linens were top quality. The flat screen tv is large and had HD channels but there were too many sports channels. The room did not have a brochure or info booklet about the hotel so I did not know if there were a fitness center or a business center, phone numbers to services, what is extra or complimentary. I did find out, after I left, that some of the info can be found on one of the TV channels. It was really hot during August and the air conditioning didnâ€™t seem to work on certain days but it didnâ€™t bother me much. Sometimes the hot water was just luke warm. I just attributed these to the age and structure of the building. Even though the hotel went through a renovation recently, the room I stayed in had a lot of scuff marks and some of the bathroom fixtures doesnâ€™t seem to last long. High rates and opulence usually goes hand in hand but for a minimalist boutique hotel with high rates might not, in these economic times. Even though it was unique, the whole experience is a bit lessen by the exclusion of little things that costs almost nothing and matters to guests such as the morning newspaper, free wi-fi, ice\coffee maker. Still, it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying in a modern art museum with access to all the sites”
Reviews.Author: zag-geek
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying here when attending a business conference because the conference hotel was full. I'm really glad I did! Price: for decent hotels in the area, this was actually one of the less expensive, corporate rate or not. Location: EXCELLENT! This hotel is right next to (literally, almost on top of) the Old State House Museum and the Boston Massacre site. From here I also walked to the 5!wits TOMB exhibit, to the Boston Gardens, to the Blue Man Group, to the Cheers bar, (none was more than about 1.5 miles tops) and I walked every day down to the wharf where my conference was and stopped to eat at a lot of great places - Legal Seafood, Quincy Market, Oceania all right there. Location felt safe. Didn't want to go down side streets much but otherwise great on the main paths. Parking/transport: don't even think about it...taxi here, taxi back. I have no idea where you would park, but it would be expensive. You're very close to mass transit too...subway about 1/2 mile away I think (down by the aquarium, might be something closer) Decor: OMG, this was the best part. The room is seriously like something in a modern art museum. Skinny chrome lamps, white bed, dark grey walls and floors in the bath, wood floor in the bedroom, white bedding, red table, comfy chair, translucent walls. Only bad things are that the dark floor shows footprints really easily (they keep it clean though) and the room requires a lot of thought - everything has a control panel and most things require some thinking to operate...which can also be kind of a fun adventure :) The faux fur blanket on the bed is the awesomest thing. So soft...I seriously considered buying one from the hotel (they will sell you almost anything in the room if you asked). For such an old building you can tell it's been remodeled very recently. Shower was nice - multiple heads. Sad there was no bathtub though... I don't know if there are in some of the nicer rooms, but there wasn't in the standard one. Amenities: Didn't check out the bar/restaurant, but there's always a party going on. Wouldn't want to be on the bottom most floor when it's really going, but it looked like fun. The exercise room is nice though...not huge, but a lot of equipment, all very new, lots of variety. Staff is incredibly helpful...all know a lot about the rooms and the area and very friendly. A few misses on the part of the housekeeping staff (forgot some toiletries, nothing major), but everyone else was incredibly professional. Check in/out was a breeze. Lovely trip...very glad I went to the Ames. The novel decor alone was worth it. The location rocked as well.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: bawden2
Reviews.Content: We had a great three nights at the Ames hotel. When we first arrived the hotel seemed noisy and i was worried we would be kept awake but the staff assured us we would here nothing and we did not. The room was clean and had everything we needed. The staff were very friendly. Hotel in great location My only gripe with the hotel which did not affect my stay but would put me off booking again with them if i took my daughter is, it did not seem to have access for a wheelchair. I could be mistaken but i know we could not access from the front of the hotel, i would stay again if we traveled without her.

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish room with fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: viaxeiranomundo
Reviews.Content: We loved the room at the Ames Hotel. It was very big and the light was incredible as we managed to get a corner room. The windows were huge and the views of down town were breathtaking. The service is fantastic but that seems to be the norm in Boston. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Slick, stylish and contemporary-”
Reviews.Author: obsessivetraveler
Reviews.Content: and located in a tourist friendly area. Easy walk to everything. Great service, good restaurant, and eye pleasing design.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and incredible service with top-notch staff”
Reviews.Author: hunken3
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Boston for college visits and to enjoy some of the incredible food and sites. My 16 year old found the Ames on the web and we decided it was close to the North End where we liked to eat. Upon arrival the staff could not have been friendlier. My daughter celebrated a birthday while in Boston and they called the restaurant and had a cake for her compliment of the Ames. One staff member stayed on the phone with me while returning a rental car. The restaurant/bar is a great place for the hip crowd. There are two T stops right there at the hotel which made getting around incredibly easy. After our daily travels, it was always nice to land at the Ames with the friendly and accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingWithStyle18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Boston from California for our anniversary. We spent two night at the Ames hotel and it was fabulous. It is in an IDEAL location, just steps from Quincy Market, Fanuel Hall, The New England Aquarium, The North End, and countless other attractions. We were surprised with a gracious upgrade to a suite! The rooms are modern and comfortable with great views of the city! There is a popular restaurant/bar located in the lobby area. We didn't get a chance to try it but I am sure it was good because it was always packed. There is a full room service menu too if you do not feel like going out. I will definitely recommend the Ames to all my friends and will for sure stay there again on our next trip out east!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique jewel in the middle of it all!”
Reviews.Author: no_snow-no-way
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel right in the middle of everything. I walked to Boston Convention Center, Boston Commons, Legal Sea Food, shops on Washington St, South Station. Chic, modern rooms with wall mounted flat screen TV & comfy king size bed. A pleasant surprise given I booked at the last minute on Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Paying A Little Extra For”
Reviews.Author: TravelCheapskate
Reviews.Content: Due to the price this is not a property we would have ordinarily considered. Even with the special deal we got it was still pricy (for us) but WELL WORTH the extra money in all respects. Pros: (1) Location -- We had never been to Boston and wanted a central location to explore the city with kids. There is no better location than this. Just a few dozen feet from the Old State House and the subway station that is located underneath. From that station we could go anywhere we needed to go with minimal hassles and delay. We were able to conveniently walk the Freedom Trail and take meals at Fanuil Hall which is just a block away. (2) Service -- The staff went out of its way to welcome us with young children. Disregard what you may have read elsewhere all comments about this being a kid unfriendly place. The staff was among the most friendly we have encountered anywhere in the world. (3) Style -- Ultra hip and super-contemporary. Not something we usually go for, but it was a great change fo pace. Pretty neat. (4) Immaculate. Probably the cleanest property we have ever visited. Cons: (1) Price. This is our first choice next time we go to Boston. No doubt about it.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular service!! Wonderful Unusual Room, Heart of Boston!”
Reviews.Author: CharlottesvilleMuse
Reviews.Content: From the first phone call to the hotel , you would have thought we were staying at a B&B. The Personal attention to all the details of our stay was truly a highlight -Not something you would expect from a large hotel. Being a building well over a 100 years old , the striking contrast of the modern interior room design created a very cool effect, creating a sense that you were staying at someplace special and unique. Peek a Boo shower , carpetless floor, very very clean ,no clutter and a very comfortable bed made this honeymoon incredibly memorable. And the location - couldn't ask for better as far as we were concerned..... Thank you to the staff for making this an over the top experience! A+++++ ALL the way around!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and Modern Room, Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: andycompare
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at larger chain hotels, but chose the Ames hotel because of its proximity to my business meeting. What a find! My room was upgraded to a suite at check-in, and what a suite it was! Very spacious, modern, immaculately clean, and comfortable. The staff was attentive, helpful, and knowledgable. The Woodward restaurant in the hotel was fun - great food, perfect service, an ideal spot for a group.

Reviews.Title: “truly a great hotel for a great city.Fresh design, helpful staff,great food”
Reviews.Author: gaelpsych
Reviews.Content: I chose to return to the Ames for a second visit in a month, first for business later for pleasure with a family member.As a seasoned traveler I can say that this was one of the most refreshing city hotel stays I have ever had...from the friendly doormen to the 'nothing is too much trouble' front desk,on to the crisp and contemporary comfort of the rooms..it was perfect.The antidote to the convention centers.The food and cocktails at Woodward were wonderful and the patio is a perfect spot for breakfast with the paper or a spot of people watching later on.I look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “We have never stayed at a more welcoming hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TamiBo
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 on a driving vacation from outside of Chicago. Started in Cape Cod and finished up our trip staying a weekend at the Ames. We pulled up in a mini-van with 4 bikes on the back, immediately Jordan and another bell hop (I apologize I don't remember his name) helped my husband unload the bikes quickly, we were on a very busy downtown street. Ian at the front desk had prior to check in told me it would be no problem to keep all 4 bikes inside the hotel. The car was valeted and we never used it again until check out. Parking is around $40/day in Boston. This isn't just what the Ames charges, I researched and it's what all the hotels charge. There is no street parking. Check in is a wonderful experience. Very calm and quite. Katie at the front desk was super friendly and personable. The concierge Charles was the icing on the cake. From the minute we met him, he went above and beyond. Making dinner reservations for us in the Italian neighborhood to fedexing us a bag that we left behind when we checked out. My husband and I also enjoyed having a cocktail at Woodard, the restaurant/bar. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Cool spot, great vibe!!”
Reviews.Author: mmbpaints
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I both loved the hotel. The staff was nice and attentive. The decor was cool, but not cold. The location was great for us! Would definitely go back and refer to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a modern look in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Eldomoo
Reviews.Content: We visited Boston for a 3 day trip accompanied by 2 6 years kids. We found this place through priceline.com. I have read the previous reviews and the comments about noise level before our travel. So, i contacted Nina Sweet and she extremely helpful and had a hand written welcome note for us on arrival. We were located in a room on the 12th floor overlooking Washington Street with a king size bed but considering that we were a party of 4, that was not very convenient. They didn't have a room with 2 double beds the first night but we were switched to another beautiful and spacious room on the 14th floor overlooking the ocean. No concerns about the noise level. Parking was fairly expensive at $42/day. For a family with 2 kids, we were hoping for a place with a swimming pool which they lacked. I feel that this place is mainly meant for business travelers or travelers without kids. Overall, a great location with very helpful staff but might not be the best place for kids. Again, Nina was

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: Iloveny2521
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wondeful weekend at the Ames. It was my boyfriend and I's first trip to Boston and we had the pleasure of staying in a beautiful suite at the Ames. The staff is very helpful, friendly and polite and the rooms are beautiful. We were lucky enough to have suite with goregous arched windows and the bathroom had a lovely shower and a nice deep tub to take a relaxing bath. Nice flat screen tv's and super comfy beds....I'll definitely be back to the Ames in the future. Thanks for everything Nina, you helped to exceed our expectations at the Ames! Also had cocktails at the hotels restaurant, the Woodward which was trendy and the drinks were delish.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was the best part of our trip”
Reviews.Author: dougandcrystal
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and very accommodating. Bar & Restaurant were quite the hot spot, but it didn't interfere with hotel guests being comfortable. Corner King Room was fantastic - bed & pillows were comfortable, flat screen tv was big and positioned well and the view was terrific. Street noise on the weekends (and it was mostly ambulances) were a little loud, but I doubt you could escape that at any hotel right in the city... and after a full day of walking around, you'll be so tired and the bed is so inviting, you won't care. Would DEFINITELY stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thewisehome
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ames for five nights in July on business trip. Wasn't particulary in the hotel much but what I did experience was very good. Great service and friendly staff all round. The rooms are lovely and clean, fresh and modern. I stayed on the fourth floor and found the room a little noisy from the outside traffic but I preferred it this way as I can't stand silence coming from a busy family home. Great central location halfway between the river and the common. Breakfast one morning I had in the hotel was great and fresh. Didn't experiance any room service though. The restaruant/bar always looked busy and lively during the day and evening which bodes well. Overall a fab hotel with good location and great people. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness an issue!”
Reviews.Author: blb407
Reviews.Content: My sister and I checked into the Ames for a fun getaway to Boston. Overall, the hotel was okay. Very nice bath products, great flat screen television, check-in moved smoothly, bed comfortable, very responsive when I asked for a linen change. There were just a few issues that colored our trip. We had been extremely excited to stay at the Ames since it first opened and we heard all the reviews. The place is very much like a W Hotel (fashion forward decor with a scene in the restaurant/bar). That part was interesting and cool. Due to reading previous reviews, I made sure to ask for a room on a high floor to avoid any noise. The woman desk clerk was very helpful and immediately offered us a room on the 14th floor. Check-in went smoothly. -People have complained about the dark hallways, but I didn't find that to be a problem. The ambiance was nice and it was bright enough to see everything you'd possibly want to see in a hallway! The problem was there really is a lot of noise you can hear from the street (14 floors below!) and the bar at night. The windows must not be double paned because you can hear actual conversations from the patio if the people are speaking loudly. I'm not joking. Because we spent the majority of time out of the room, this wasn't a problem. However, each night we came back to the hotel around 1am (Fri. & Sat. night) and the noise was pretty loud. So, if you're staying at the Ames for business, you may want to take that into consideration. Also, once we made our way to the room after checking in we walked in and noticed black marks on one wall and a hair pendant left from a previous guest. The bathroom shower was also not cleaned adequately. My sister and I aren't squeamish, so we just let those things go. However, the level of scuff marks on the white walls was truly unsatisfactory. The main problem we had with the Ames were the bugs we kept finding running around the hotel room. It was seriously disturbing. We saw silverfish and this other black amoeba looking bug that I had no idea what it was. It was inky black and very hard to kill. They seemed to come out the most at night. -When checking out, I thought I'd mention the bug issue so they could spray the room and save another hotel guest from suffering through that. I mentioned it to the guy at the front desk when checking out & he was wholly disinterested. As I started to tell him about the bugs, he looked down at his computer and was so uninterested and dismissive as to what I had to say that he wouldn't even make eye contact. He started typing and uh huhing me (as in, yeah- whatever). I finished telling him about the bugs. He still wouldn't look up from the computer, so I left. -For that reason, it is unlikely I'll ever stay at the Ames again. If they're so uninterested about a bug infestation, I have no desire to stay in a hotel like that. For the prices they charge, I expect very clean rooms. I felt on edge all weekend and didnâ€™t want to walk barefoot in the room. If the Ames fixes its' bug problem and starts cleaning the rooms well, it's a fun place to go for a weekend away. The location is great and the bar/restaurant a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Boston, July, 2010”
Reviews.Author: phil048
Reviews.Content: The Ames Hotel in Boston is centrally located to all major sites and attractions in the city, including areas like Quincy/Faneuil Hall Marketplace, Boston Commons, Beacon Hill (Cheers Bar), most historical sites and the Harbor/Wharf areas. Trolley tours were also available within walking distance from the Ames Hotel. The accomodations at the Ames Hotel were great, including room service and the concierge desk. If you drive on a weekend stay at the Ames, you might want to consider using the parking garage down Washington St. at a reduced rate. You can travel to Fenway Park (Red Sox) to see a game via Trolley, car or cab.

Reviews.Title: “Was not impressed...except by the location.”
Reviews.Author: klear
Reviews.Content: It looked good, based on the reviews here and otherwise but issues popped up: Pros: - Location, location,....It is right next to Faneuil Hall. Cons: - It feels unfinished. The rooms do not have have the usual Hotel info packet in them. The modern rooms are already slightly used up. There is no ice machine on any floor. - I realize is is fairly standard for hotels in this class but paying for internet in this day and age seems a tad antiquated when Starbucks across the street has it for free. - My biggest issue was that our room was not done by 4:15 PM, we left at 9AM and there no "please clean up" sign to put on, on Sunday when we came back from walking over 7 miles around town with my 65-year old mother. The hotel receptionnist kept sputtering "They have until 6PM to do your room" which did not endear her to my mother. It took them over half an hour to fix up the room. In all my years of travelling, this is the first time this has happened to me in a 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “request a room with a bathtub”
Reviews.Author: lmw26
Reviews.Content: when we first checked in, our assigned room had a lovely shower, but i had really been looking forward to a bath, and i remembered that the website said the room had a bath. i called downstairs, and they switched us to the same class of room with a bathtub, and it was by far the best bath i've ever taken. the tub was longer than 5 ft and must have been about 3 feet deep. there was a glass wall between the bathroom and bedroom, which made the room feel so open. it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Central, sleek, great service and have the duck parfait flatbread”
Reviews.Author: LazySeagull
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for business. Absolutely delighted from the moment I arrived to the moment I left (and I do a lot of business travel staying in city CBDs, so have some context for comparison). And the location is excellent (central boston). Can't recommend this highly enough. If you can, grab a beer and the duck parfait flatbread from the restaurant downstairs, but don't expect the flatbread to be entree size - it is huge!

Reviews.Title: “A Me-Time Getaway to the City”
Reviews.Author: SuburbanAdventurer04
Reviews.Content: The Ames is located within a comfortable walking distance of so many Boston landmarks and venues.. just one of the reasons I keep coming back. Upon arrival at the hotel I was in a rush to get a pedicure - the conceirge quickly provided me the names and directions to 3 affordable salons and then took charge of getting my bags to my room. I happily returned an hour later, my schedule intact. Dinner was a pleasant walk to the North End for a wonderful rooftop wine and dinner at Fiore's followed by gelato heaven just a couple blocks north. There was a small rain shower but I had smartly taken the umbrella The Ames supplies in every guest room. Eventually made it over to the Hatchshell for the free Friday Night Movie, tonight it was Star Wars. Took a stroll past the Ritz and down Washington St on my return to The Ames where I stopped in for a nightcap in the always hopping, always packed 2-story restaurant/bar. My Ames guestroom - perfect - if I could pack it up and take the entire thing home, that is a fantasy. The plush platform bed, the bedding, the ipod radio, the glass walled shower which creates the most unique room divider between bath and bedroom, the panoramic window wall with city view. But back to that shower...it includes a hand held wand that shoots a playful stream of water...very nice. On this trip I did not eat at the hotel but the hotel breakfast menu was a satisfying read. It was such a beautiful sunny humid-free morning that I wanted to walk, eventually stopping for a coffee and bagel at my regular chain - DunkinDonuts. Check out was a breeze at 11am. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “great location, fabulous restaurant”
Reviews.Author: svbarb
Reviews.Content: morgans new ames hotel is a gem. the location is an easy ride from the airport. you are walking distance from outstanding restaurants and shops.the unassuming sidewalk cafe has some of the best food and service we have experienced.be sure to contact manager nina sweet as she will be sure your stay is perfect as far as room location and requests. every staff member has had superb training in customer service. it is still a hidden gem so go now before the word is out.

Reviews.Title: “So Impressed - THANK YOU Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: AnuHP
Reviews.Content: Aside from being a beautiful modern hotel I was very grateful for the help of the housekeeping team. We left behing a pair of pretty expensive and new trousers behind. I was pretty frantic and they called me back immediately and arranged to ship it back to me. This kind of service matters to me.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip”
Reviews.Author: MilaZR
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great! great location, close to everything. Very modern and clean. Definitely stay in the room with the glass bathroom wall, very unique. The staff was very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service at a modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zisil86
Reviews.Content: I booked the Ames because it looked really modern and trendy and was close to an event we had for the weekend. The front of the hotel can be easily missed because it blends right in with the other business buildings in the area, but rest assured once inside it is just amazing. On the first floor there is a restaurant and bar that is fun to go to at night. The check in was very easy and the staff very friendly. However when we got to our room it wasn't what we expected. One of the best features of the hotel is getting the glass bathroom and this one didn't have it. They quickly switched our rooms and accommodated our request. We then were in a room with a a great view of the city. The room itself was trendy with modern furniture, a large flat screen tv and a comfortable bed. This set a great tone for the weekend and the staff were nothing but helpful for the rest of our stay. I would definitely recommend to stay at the Ames.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in an excellent location-PERFECT!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: future6150
Reviews.Content: The Ames is in a great location in a beautiful building. Hotel entrance is modern and very welcoming. Great staff throughout the hotel. Bedrooms are awesome, modern clean lines but still having the feel of being cosy and with mgnificent views of the city. Woodwards is the place to be ( the restaurant/bar at the hotel) food is exquisite and again the service is excellent. This hotel has the full package.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MikeyL0ND0N
Reviews.Content: Although I've stayed in many Morgans hotels in the past (Hudson, Mondrian LA, Sanderson, Shore Club) I was starting to get a little tired of them as I felt they sacrificed substance over style. That is however simply not the case at the Ames...not only is it stylish but its one of the nicest places I've stayed at. The big selling point of this place is not necessarily the great central location or beautiful comfortable rooms but the amazing staff! I like to stay in trendy boutique hotels, but very often I feel that in those types of establishments the staff have better things to do than to look after you...that's certainly not the case here. Great staff, great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Whoever hired their staff is a genius. Sets a new standard for great service.”
Reviews.Author: LisaKnoxville
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ames Hotel this past weekend to visit my college daughter with her aunts, uncle and cousins (10 and 13). First, the location is perfect. around the corner from Fanueill Hall and across the street from the old state house at Government Center T stop. It is a bit hard to find because it is so cool that it does not have a sign outside. Look for the Ames Building and you're there. The restaurant is very happening with great food and excellent service particularly if you are lucky enough to sit in Katherine's section. She made our chic reunion night super special. Emily at the front desk went over and beyond to help arrange fun things to do while we were there and Charles, the concierge has great connections and suggestions. Knowing what people will enjoy and creating experiences for them is a talent and he has it. So I was already planning on writing a rave review about how much fun we had and then my daughter became very ill (stomach virus) on what was supposed to be our last day. Emily and Charles helped get her to Mass General Hospital, extended our stay and arranged for the chef to make chicken broth and ginger ale for her to eat when we got home from the ER. They even called upstairs to check on her. Right down to the valet who remembered our names, the service was stellar. I had a much different experience at XV Beacon on one of our previous trips to Boston which I have also reviewed. Hands down..don't stay anywhere else but the Ames Hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Classiest hotel I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: englebretsen
Reviews.Content: Unbelieveable room, great service, easy check-in/valet, great restraunt/bar called woodward in hotel lobby, comfortable bed, 42' plasma TV, best location in Boston; one minute walk to historical Fanueil Hall!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property”
Reviews.Author: showguy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many properties in Boston, but none like the Ames. Our experience was exceptional throughout the stay. From the super-friendly valets who met us at the curb to the pleasant reception desk staff, we couldn't help but feel comfortable upon arrival. Once we got to the room, things got even better. The clean lines and cool decor set this hotel apart from the others in town. The wood floors give the room a clean, fresh feel and the glass bathroom is very unique. We stayed on the 15th floor and found it to be very quiet, even with the minimal street noise. I will definitely be sendinf friends and family to the Ames Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel in ideal location...”
Reviews.Author: Urbans
Reviews.Content: We recently spent an extended weekend at the Ames. The hotel was perfect for our visit to Boston which included a tour of the Harbor Islands and a game at Fenway. Located in the financial distinct, we could walk from the Ames to Faneuil Hall, North End, and the Long Wharf for lunch and dinner. The T stations were even closer. Couldn't be more convenient The room was stylish, bed was wonderful, and the minibar was over-the-top. Easily one of the best rooms we've ever stayed in. We have only good things to say about our stay at the historic Ames.

Reviews.Title: “First class in every respect!”
Reviews.Author: rhodymetsfan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were planning a night in Boston as a "getaway" and decided to try a different hotel apart from the standard Marriotts, Westin, etc. I had heard good things about Morgan hotels in the past so we took a shot with the Ames. We absolutely LOVED it and wished we could have stayed a few more nights. From the welcoming staff...to the top notch restaurant, to the very cool, comfortable room, we couldn't have had a better experience. I also loved being able to walk two minutes to Quincy Market for Sunday breakfast. The Ames will definitely be our Boston hotel of choice going forward.

Reviews.Title: “This was the absolute best hotel stay we have ever experienced.”
Reviews.Author: RichardL22
Reviews.Content: The staff, the view, and the location were all excellent. We had a great visit and would advise anyone to book their stay with Ames.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best comfortable room I have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: HotelBlogs
Reviews.Content: My second stay in Boston was promised to be short but maybe too short for a stay at Ames Hotel. I have really enjoyed this hotel from the warm welcome at the reception to the neutrality and calm atmosphere of the room. First of all, when I arrived, I realized that I messed up with my arrival day and was expected to stay in the hotel only the day after. Because the hotel was fully booked, the 2 receptionists were kind enough to find me a room. After several phone calls, they found the last room at their neighbor 4* hotel. The next day, I couldn't wait to see what my room looked like. What I like about Morgans Hotel is how they choose carefully furniture and the colors of the room. When you enter the room, it kind of gets you relaxed and calm. Neutrality of colour have been carefully chosen. The power shower was a real treat in early mornings of my stay (meaning 4am with the jetlag). Also, I have enjoyed the big TV screen for insomniac like me. I ordered also breakfast which was delivered within 20 min even before the opening of the breakfast service. The breakfast was really good with salmon and scrambled eggs. Also appreciate the fast check out service when my taxi was waiting for me at 6am to go to Boston Airport. Thank you again Ames Hotel, You made my short stay in Boston a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel. Great location”
Reviews.Author: lazyeyepatch
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here during a visit to Boston. Really cool funky hotel. Decor was very modern. Rooms were of a nice size and clean. Washroom was cool too, with towel warmers and a nice size. Bed was comfortable. Location was great. A block from the T, Faneuil, shopping, and 2 blocks from Boston Commons. Cant really go wrong. The only problem is that it is a bit hard to find as there is no sign that we noticed. Was literally right next to it when we asked for directions. The restaurant/bar was very busy and loud at night. Only noticed it when entering the lobby. Our room was on the 8th floor so we didnt notice any noise. Cant comment whehther or not it would be heard if you were on a lower floor. Overall had a great stay. Would be nice if they had free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Kaxmax
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights - considering the location and that there was construction outside, the external noise was minimal - problem was internal noise. Agree with other comments on banging doors and elevator noise - particularly bad when housekeeping starts working the floor in the morning (I was on business and they woke me up even with my having appts and getting up at reasonable hours). Overall - the room was clean and comfortable, appreciated that the windows opened for some fresh air - gave it a European feeling that I don't often find at US hotels. Very easy to get to most locations by foot or public transport - even a rental car location just blocks away for excursions. Staff were polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: MartyBeingMarty
Reviews.Content: As of today the Ames is the only hotel I'll use in Boston. The other reviews are spot-on, but I would stress three things. First, the hotel staff is exceedingly well trained with a strong focus on customer service and courtesy. Better than I got at the Four Seasons. Second, the location is beyond convenient. We could walk to all our meetings and for others, both cabs and transit are available right outside. Third, the building is beautiful. The Morgans group did an impressive job preserving the natural beauty of a very old office building. I'm really surprised that its ranking on tripadvisor isn't higher. I think it's the best.

Reviews.Title: “A Pearl and Oasis in Downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: profeoosr
Reviews.Content: Ames was a new experience to me. having been a loyal client to the Morgan group for many years, I finally made it to theior new property in Boston last week. A wonderful exoerience; for me as a seasoned business traveller but also someone who likes e great 'treat' I found the Ames to be of outstanding quality, and the rooms and facilities to be world class. Strong recommend! Ulf Lindgren Professor of Strategy & Dean Lorange Business School Zurich

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Friendly Hotel Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: GoGatorsBristow_VA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at the Ames. Everyone we encountered at the hotel was extremely friendly, especially John, one of the greeters/bellman and the bartender, whose name, unfortunately, we did not remember. Our room was immaculate, as was the hotel itself. It was also, very conveniently located to everthing-the Freedom Trail, Quincy Market and the subway. My only complaint would be no coffee pot in the room or in the lobby, but the restaurant provided coffee every morning, without charge, which was nice. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends, and in fact, already have.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I hoped for!”
Reviews.Author: MRinNY
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful 3 night stay. Staff were very friendly and attentive, without being obtrusive. The room was well appointed with lovely finishes- the mini bar was extremely well stocked. The hotel is close to the Marketplace, Faneuil Hall etc. and within walking distance to pretty well everything I wanted. The hop-on hop-off bus tours stop at the front door, very convenient. The 'hash' dishes on the breakfast menu are highly recommended...who doesn't want to start their day with 'lobster and leek'? And, it would have to be the best breakfast coffee I've been served in the States.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding boutique hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Ewok
Reviews.Content: The Ames Hotel was the highlight of my weekend away to Boston. With a stylish interior it is perfectly located across the street from State T station. The bar/restaurant was packed every night we were there with hotel guests and the after work crowd. The fitness centre, although small, was perfect for my daily cardio workouts. The hotel room was so luxurious and comfortable - I couldn't wait to return to the hotel everyday! A special thanks goes out to Nina and Charles for making my fiance's birthday a memorable day. I cannot express how grateful I am for their efforts. I will definitely stay at Ames if I return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Ames made our trip that much better!”
Reviews.Author: cpersha
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Boston and I will stay at the Ames each time I return! The staff went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable and to ensure we were comfortable. The location was amazing and the rooms were clean, stylish, and welcoming. I have never felt so at home at a hotel! Thank you Ames for making my trip that much better!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: moon6867
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the ames hotel in Boston with my girlfriend over Memorial day weekend. As soon as we walked in we were greated with smiles and a free upgrade to our room! This doesn't happen often but was nice as a first impression. The staff was extremely helpful and knowledgable of restaraunts, the city and different attractions to see. I had also requested a late check-out the morning of our last day so that we could go on a tour and they offered me an even later check-out time than I had requested with out any problems. This to me said they were willing to accommodate my needs as much as possible which I appreciated greatly. I recommend this hotel to everyone deciding to travel to boston. The location is perfect, the rooms are clean and amazing with a very modern feel, and there are plenty of attractions within walking distance from the hotel which is always nice. The staff was unbelievable and very curteous always willing to help and I must say that any time I have friends or family traveling to boston I will recommend this hotel every time. I will definitely visit boston again and I will be sure to stay here. The price of a 2-3 star hotel, with the amenities, rooms and staff of a 5 star hotel...You cannot beat this place! You will be missing out if you pass this hotel up for some big name chain. They are an up and coming hotel in boston that will only continue to rise through their service and professionalism!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay until the 5th and last night - marred by party in room next door.”
Reviews.Author: PacNWH2O
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great time in Boston and at Ames until our 5th and last night. I'm reluctantly writing this review because I called Ames 2 weeks in advance of booking and spoke to the assistant manager, Nina, about Trip Advisor reviews regarding partying neighbors, noise from the street/subway, and room configurations. Nina could not have been more reassuring or accommodating. She upgraded our room and booked us on the top floor, which alleviated much of the street noise as well as from Woodward, the "hot" restaurant/bar at Ames which generated it's very own noise level all the way up to the 7th and 8th floor of the hotel (open access between Woodward, hotel lobby, and stairwells). I was also assured that the partying was an isolated incident and that security monitored the elevators and guest floors. I'm writing this review to say that we were disturbed by a party in the room next to us at 2 AM, and that it isn't an isolated incident if it happens more than once. Also, security didn't seem to know what to do, nor did the overnight staff seem get why we were so upset about offering US the option to move at 2:45 AM on our last night. Our room was comped for the night, as well as breakfast during our stay. After several e-mail exchanges with Nina, I wish them all the best on security and overnight staff improvements. Ames could be so much better than average.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: JoshuaSims
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly priced hotel, and very chic, the staff (outside of the cleaning staff) are amazing and helpful... Its only down fall are the occasional "price-line" customer which has no clue and would be better off at a best western.... This is a hip hotel, for cool urbanites that are in Boston to see the town, paint it red, and look fabulous while doing it. People with kid's and bed times don't belong and should stay somewhere else. You want to see and be seen here, and not with diapers. The last thing, and I mean this, I want to see in a hotel of this caliper is a family with unruly brats. That said, would you please sort out the maid staff and get the rooms freshened before I get back after being gone for 24 hours .. fix those two things and you have the best hotel for the money in Boston... (NO MORE PRICE LINE)

Reviews.Title: “Either I am not the right traveler for this Hotel or I found every bump in the place!”
Reviews.Author: caralex
Reviews.Content: So maybe it is me! I booked this hotel through Priceline decent rate for a 4 star (love the Taj however). Called on my way to the Ames from Acadia and asked specifically for a room away from the elevator. It took me 30 minutes to find the place beacuse there is no sign - when I called to get help the staff told me that it is a historic building - therefore no sign - please spare me! Once I arrived, the woman I spoke to informed me that my room was located in front of the elevator. And I actually spoke to her on the phone. Strike two! All i wanted was a quiet night. I was accommodated to a corner room on the top floor and the kitchen did provide me tea and toast at 11 pm tho no knife for the butter.!! At 3 am my next door neighbors came home and slammed the door twice and I kid you not - slammed. The doors are slammy anyway. That is certainly something they can correct. Went back to sleep and decided to dine in at the hotel - what a disaster - no one is in a hurry to help - From the time I was seated to the time i left it was 25 minutes - no food. I said that it felt like I was sitting there for 30 minutes and the waiter said no it was not it was 10-15 minutes! Actually it was 25 minutes. They were doing a photo shoot and the food for the photo shoot took precedence. That really sums up my opinion of the place - all about them not about the guest. The front desk person apologized and said that she was taking my tea off the bill and last laugh on me it was on my final bill after all. All flash and no cache! Loved the TAJ!!! Service extraordinaire!

Reviews.Title: “Ames has the BEST staff in boston.”
Reviews.Author: hfish44
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Boston was made better as a result of our Ames stay. The staff bent over backwards to accomodate our every need. The location was fabulous the rooms were spacious and comfortable and a great TV. The front desk and concierge were able to make great restaurant recomendations.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the city of Boston and the Ames was the cherry on top!”
Reviews.Author: ghavansmommy
Reviews.Content: The Ames was a wonderful little hotel- such a nice switch from the huge impersonal ones. The entire staff from the front desk to the restaurant staff, cleaning people, door guys, and concierge were super friendly and helpful. Ames is in walking distance to everything. Without second thought I will stay there next time I'm in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Such a find!”
Reviews.Author: joanna301
Reviews.Content: This place is just wonderful. The staff is so accommodating and the rooms are really smart and modern. It made for such a nice stay in Boston. I can't recommend it enough. It is a steal on Priceline.com.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service from warm and very friendly staff throughout our stay.”
Reviews.Author: zazou1
Reviews.Content: Hotel in a safe and easy to get around Boston position. All staff were warm and friendly,nothing was too much trouble.There was an eclectic mix of guests. The restaurant and bar had a positive buzz. The room was excellent and lounge areas were small but inviting.

HotelInfo.Name: Ames - A Morgans Original
HotelInfo.Address: 1 Court Street, Boston, MA 02108
